Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Interest Payments: 
The notes bear interest at a rate of 8.50% per annum. We will pay interest on 
the notes semi-annually, in arrears, on April&nbsp;1 and October&nbsp;1 of each 
year, commencing April 1, 2014.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,

10pt"></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA31><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Ranking: The notes 
will be our general unsecured senior obligations and will be subordinated to all
of our existing and future secured debt to the extent of the assets securing 
that secured debt and pari passu with all of our existing and future senior 
debt. In addition, the notes will be effectively subordinated to all of the 
liabilities of our subsidiaries. BPZ Resources, Inc. is a holding company. All 
of our significant operations are conducted at our operating
subsidiaries.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB33  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA34><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA35><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Conversion Rights: 
Holders may convert their notes at any time prior to the close of business on 
the second business day immediately preceding the maturity date under the 
following circumstances: (1) during any fiscal quarter (and only during such 
fiscal quarter) commencing after October 1, 2013, if the last reported sale 
price of our common stock is greater than or equal to 130% of the conversion 
price of the notes (as defined herein) for at least 20 trading days in the 
period of 30-day consecutive-trading-day period ending on the last trading day 
of the preceding fiscal quarter; (2) prior to July 1, 2017, during the five 
business-day period after any ten consecutive trading-day period (the 
&#8220;measurement period&#8221;) in which the trading price of $1,000 principal
amount of notes for each trading day in the measurement period was less than 97%
of the product of the last reported sale price of our common stock and the 
conversion rate on such trading day; or (3) upon the occurrence of one of 
specified corporate transactions described in this prospectus supplement. 
Holders may also convert their notes at their option at any time beginning on 
July 1, 2017, and ending at the close of business on the second business day 
immediately preceding the maturity date.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB37  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA38><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA39><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Conversion Rate: 
The initial conversion rate will be&nbsp;249.5866 shares of our common stock per
$1,000 principal amount of notes, subject to adjustment. This is equivalent to 
an initial conversion price of approximately $4.01 per share of common stock. 
Upon conversion, we will deliver, at our option, shares of our common stock 
(together with cash in lieu of fractional shares), cash or a combination thereof
in respect of the remainder, if any, of our conversion obligation in excess of 
the aggregate principal amount of the notes being converted. 
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

interest to, but excluding, the fundamental change repurchase date. </FONT><FONT
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We may not redeem the notes prior to the maturity 
thereof.</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR3926 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px">&nbsp;</P>
<HR style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; TEXT-ALIGN: center; BORDER-LEFT: medium 
none; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000; WIDTH: 20%; HEIGHT: 1px; COLOR: #000000; 
BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-RIGHT: medium none">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA181><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>ABOUT THIS PROSPECTUS SUPPLEMENT</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA182><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 35pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA183><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This document is in two parts. The first part is this 
prospectus supplement, which describes the specific terms of this offering of 
our convertible senior notes. The second part is the accompanying prospectus, 
which gives more general information, some of which may not apply to this 
offering of our convertible senior notes. If the information about the 
convertible senior notes offering varies between this prospectus supplement and 
the accompanying prospectus, you should rely on the information in this 
prospectus supplement.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 35pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA184><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 35pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA185><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">You should rely only on the information contained in this 
prospectus supplement and in the accompanying prospectus, including any 
information incorporated by reference. We have not authorized any other person 
to provide you with different information. If anyone provides you with different
or inconsistent information, you should not rely on it. You should not assume 
that the information appearing in this prospectus supplement and the 
accompanying prospectus or any document incorporated by reference is accurate at
any date other than as of the date of each such document. Our business, 
financial condition, results of operations and prospects may have changed since 
the date indicated on the cover page&nbsp;of such documents.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 35pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA186><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 35pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA187><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The distribution of this prospectus supplement and the 
accompanying prospectus may be restricted by law in certain jurisdictions. You 
should inform yourself about and observe any of these restrictions. This 
prospectus supplement and the accompanying prospectus do not constitute, and may
not be used in connection with, an offer or solicitation by anyone in any 
jurisdiction in which the offer or solicitation is not authorized, or in which 
the person making the offer or solicitation is not qualified to do so, or to any
person to whom it is unlawful to make the offer or solicitation.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 35pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA188><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 35pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA189><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Information contained on or accessible through our website does
not constitute part of this prospectus supplement or the prospectus.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 35pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA190><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 35pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA191><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">When used in this prospectus supplement and the accompanying 
prospectus, the terms &#8220;we,&#8221; &#8220;us,&#8221; &#8220;our,&#8221; 
&#8220;BPZ&#8221; and &#8220;the Company&#8221; refer to BPZ 
Resources,&nbsp;Inc., a Texas corporation, and its subsidiaries (unless the 
context indicates another meaning).</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 35pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA192><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA193><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We use certain terms commonly used in the oil and natural gas 
industry in this prospectus supplement and the accompanying prospectus. Please 
refer to the &#8220;Glossary of Oil and Natural Gas Terms&#8221; in our Form 10-
K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2012, incorporated by reference herein, 
for the definitions of such terms.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA194><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3927.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK3927 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR3927 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM3927 >S-
1</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR3927 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3927.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA199><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>THE COMPANY</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA200><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA201><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><I>This is only a summary and does not contain all the 
information that may be important to you before investing in our convertible 
senior notes. You should carefully read the prospectus supplement and the 
accompanying prospectus, including the &#8220;Risk Factors&#8221; section 
starting on page&nbsp;S-13 of this prospectus supplement, as well as the
financial statements and the other information described in this prospectus 
supplement under the headings &#8220;Where You Can Find More Information&#8221; 
and &#8220;Information Incorporated by Reference&#8221; and incorporated by 
reference herein before making an investment decision.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA202><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA203><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We are based in Houston, Texas with offices in Lima, Peru and 
Quito, Ecuador. We are focused on the exploration, development and production of
oil and natural gas in Peru and, to a lesser extent, Ecuador. We also intend to 
utilize part of our planned future natural gas production as a supply source for
the complementary development of a gas-fired power generation facility in Peru, 
which we expect to wholly or partially own.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA204><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA205><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We maintain a subsidiary, BPZ Exploraci&#243;n&nbsp;&amp; 
Producci&#243;n S.R.L. (&#8220;BPZ E&amp;P&#8221;), registered in Peru through 
our wholly-owned subsidiary BPZ Energy International Holdings, L.P., a British 
Virgin Islands limited partnership, and its subsidiary BPZ Energy, LLC, a Texas 
limited liability company. Currently, we, through BPZ E&amp;P, have exclusive 
rights and license contracts for oil and gas exploration and production, which, 
as of June 30, 2013, covered a total of approximately 2.2 million acres (1.9 
million net of interests subject to our joint venture in Block Z-1) in four 
blocks in northwest Peru. Our license contracts cover ownership of the following
properties: 51% working interest in Block Z-1 (0.6 million gross acres), 100% 
working interest in Block XIX (0.5 million gross acres), 100% working interest 
in Block XXII (0.9 million gross acres) and 100% working interest in Block XXIII
(0.2 million gross acres). The Block Z-1 contract was signed in 
November&nbsp;2001, the Block XIX contract was signed in December&nbsp;2003 and 
the Blocks XXII and XXIII contracts were signed in November&nbsp;2007. 
Generally, according to Peru&#8217;s Organic Hydrocarbon Law No.&nbsp;26221 and 
the regulations thereunder (the &#8220;Organic Hydrocarbon Law&#8221; or 
&#8220;Hydrocarbon Law&#8221;), the seven-year term for the exploration phase 
can be extended in each contract by an additional three years up to a maximum of
ten years, provided that Perupetro S.A. (&#8220;Perupetro&#8221;), a corporation
owned by the Peruvian government empowered to negotiate and enter into contracts
for the exploration and exploitation of hydrocarbons on behalf of Peru in order 
to promote these activities in Peru, agrees to the extension and we comply with 
the minimum work programs and requirements of the exploration phase. However, 
specific provisions of each license contract can vary the exploration phase of 
the contract as established by the Hydrocarbon Law. The license contracts 
require us to conduct specified activities in the respective blocks during each 
exploration period in the exploration phase. If the exploration activities are 
successful, we may decide to enter the exploitation phase and our total contract
term can extend up to 30 years for oil exploration and production and up to 40 
years for gas exploration and production. In the event a block contains both oil
and gas, as is the case in our Block Z-1, the 40-year term may apply to oil 
exploration and production as well.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA206><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA207><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Additionally, through our wholly-owned subsidiary, SMC Ecuador 
Inc., a Delaware corporation, and its registered branch in Ecuador, we own a 10%
non-operating net profits interest in an oil and gas producing property, Block 
2, located in the southwest region of Ecuador (the &#8220;Santa Elena 
Property&#8221;). In May 2013, the license agreement and operating agreement 
covering the property&nbsp;were extended from May 2016 to December
2029.</FONT></P>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA208><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA209><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We are in the process of developing our Peruvian oil and gas 
resources.&nbsp;&nbsp;We entered commercial production for Block Z-1 in 
November&nbsp;2010 and produce and sell oil from the Corvina and Albacora fields
under our current sales contracts.&nbsp;&nbsp;We completed the installation of 
the new CX-15 platform in the Corvina field to continue the development of the 
field.&nbsp;&nbsp;We are also appraising the potential oil reserves from the A 
platform in the Albacora field of Block Z-1.&nbsp;&nbsp;In July 2013, we spudded
the first development well from the new CX-15 platform.&nbsp; From the time we 
began producing from the CX-11 platform in the Corvina field in November 2007 
and the Albacora field in December 2009, through June 30, 2013, we have produced
approximately 6.2 MMBbls of oil.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA210><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA211><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On December 14, 2012, Perupetro approved the terms of an 
amendment to the Block Z-1 license contract to recognize the sale of a 49% 
participating interest (&#8220;closing&#8221;) in offshore Block Z-1 to Pacific 
Rubiales Energy Corp. (&#8220;Pacific Rubiales&#8221;). Under the terms of the 
agreements signed on April 27, 2012, we (together with our subsidiaries) formed 
an unincorporated joint venture relationship with a Pacific Rubiales subsidiary,
Pacific Stratus Energy S.A., a company organized under the laws of Panama, to 
explore and develop the offshore Block Z-1. Pursuant to the agreements, Pacific 
Rubiales agreed to pay $150 million for a 49% participating interest in Block Z-
1 and agreed to fund $185 million of our share of capital and exploratory 
expenditures in Block Z-1</FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"> </FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(&#8220;the carry 
amount&#8221;) from the effective date of the Stock Purchase Agreement 
(&#8220;SPA&#8221;), January 1, 2012. On December 30, 2012, the Peruvian 
Government signed the Supreme Decree for the execution of the amendment to the 
Block Z-1 license contract.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA212><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA213><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The development of Block Z-1 is subject to the terms and 
conditions of a Joint Operating Agreement with Pacific Rubiales that governs the
legal, technical and operating rights and obligations of the parties with 
respect to the joint operations of Block Z-1. Under the agreement, we are the 
operator and carry out administrative, regulatory, government and community 
related duties, and Pacific Rubiales manages the technical and operating duties 
in Block Z-1. The Joint Operating Agreement will continue for the term of the 
license contract and thereafter until all decommissioning obligations under the 
license contract have been satisfied.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA214><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3928.1>&nbsp;</P>

reserves, which we have identified in Corvina, but for which no market has yet 
been developed and related financing has yet to be 
obtained.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA249><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA250><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Proved Reserves</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA251><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA252><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our estimated proved oil reserve quantities as of December 31, 
2012 were prepared by Netherland, Sewell&nbsp;&amp; Associates,&nbsp;Inc. 
(&#8220;NSAI&#8221;), independent petroleum engineers. NSAI was chosen based on 
its knowledge of and experience in the region in which we operate. Numerous 
uncertainties arise in estimating quantities of proved reserves and projecting 
future rates of production and the timing of development expenditures. These 
uncertainties are greater for properties which are undeveloped or have a limited
production history, such as our properties in Northern Peru. Our actual 
reserves, future rates of production and timing of development expenditures may 
vary substantially from these estimates. See Risk Factors, &#8220;<I>Our reserve
estimates depend on many assumptions that may turn out to be 
inaccurate</I>&#8221; for further information. All of our proved reserves are in
the Corvina and Albacora fields. Our net quantities of proved developed and 
undeveloped reserves of crude oil and standardized measure of future net cash 
flows are reflected in the table below. See further information about the basis 
of presentation of these amounts in &#8220;Supplemental Oil and Gas Disclosures 
(Unaudited)&#8221; in our consolidated financial statements in our Form 10-K for
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2012, incorporated by reference
herein.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA253><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA254><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As of December&nbsp;31, 2012, we owned a 51% working interest 
in the Corvina and Albacora fields, subject to Peruvian government royalties of 
5% to 20% depending on the level of production. The effect of these royalty 
interest payments is reflected in the calculation of our net proved reserves. 
Our estimate of proved reserves has been prepared under the assumption that our 
Block Z-1 license contract will allow production for the possible 40-year term 
for both oil and gas.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA255><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA256><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">At December&nbsp;31, 2012, we had estimated net proved oil 
reserves of 16.4 MMBbls, of which&nbsp;13.4 MMBbls were in the Corvina field and
3.0 MMBbls were&nbsp;in the Albacora field. Both fields are located in Block Z-1
offshore of northwest Peru. Of our total proved reserves, 2.1 MMBbls 
(12.8%)&nbsp;are classified as proved reserves consisting of proved developed 
producing and proved developed non-producing reserves from 12 gross (6.1 net) 
wells, and 14.3 MMBbls (87.2%) are classified as proved undeveloped reserves. 
See &#8220;Supplemental Oil and Gas Disclosures (Unaudited)&#8221; in our 
consolidated financial statements in our Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended 
December&nbsp;31, 2012, incorporated by reference herein, for further 
information.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3929.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK3929 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR3929 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM3929 >S-
3</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR3929 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3929.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA257><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA258><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Net Proved Crude Oil Reserves and Future Net Cash Flows</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA259><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA260><FONT

Times, serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" 
id=TBL283.finRow.8.trail.2 noWrap>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, 
Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" id=TBL283.finRow.8.lead.B3>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, 
Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" id=TBL283.finRow.8.symb.B3>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, 
Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; 
VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" id=TBL283.finRow.8.amt.B3>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="BORDER-BOTTOM: medium none; TEXT-ALIGN: right; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0px; 
BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" 
id=TBL283.finRow.8.trail.B3>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA284><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA285><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">These estimates are based upon a reserve report prepared by 
NSAI, as of December 31, 2012. NSAI&nbsp;used internally developed reserve 
estimates and criteria in compliance with the SEC guidelines based on data we 
provided. NSAI&#8217;s report is attached as Exhibit&nbsp;99.1 to our 
Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December 31, 2012.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA286><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA287><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The reserve volumes and values as of December 31, 2012 were 
determined under the method prescribed by the SEC, which requires the use of an 
average price, calculated as the twelve-month first day of the month historical 
average price for the twelve-month period prior to the end of the reporting
period, unless prices are defined by contractual arrangements, excluding 
escalations based upon future conditions. </FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA288><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA289><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As of December&nbsp;31, 2012, we did not have any proved 
undeveloped reserves previously disclosed that have remained undeveloped for 
five years or more. </FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA290><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA291><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Our Business Plan</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA292><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA293><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our business plan is to enhance shareholder value by applying 
our knowledge of targeted areas in Peru and leveraging management&#8217;s 
experience with local suppliers and regulatory authorities to effectively and 
efficiently (i)&nbsp;identify and quantify the potential value of our oil and 
gas holdings in Peru; (ii)&nbsp;develop and increase production and cash flows 
from our identified holdings; (iii)&nbsp;create an additional revenue stream 
through implementation of our gas market strategy; and (iv) bring working 
interest partners into some or all of our Peruvian blocks to facilitate the 
exploration and development of these blocks. Our management team has extensive 
engineering, geological, geophysical, technical and operational experience and 
extensive knowledge of oil and gas operations throughout Latin America and, in 
particular, Peru.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA294><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA295><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our focus is to re-appraise and develop properties that we 
control under license agreements in northwest Peru that have been explored by 
other companies and have reservoirs that appear to contain commercially 
productive quantities of oil and gas, as well as other areas that have 
geological formations that we believe potentially contain commercial amounts of 
hydrocarbons. </FONT></P>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA297>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA298><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Two of the four blocks (Block Z-1 and Block XXIII) contain 
structures drilled by previous operators who encountered hydrocarbons. However, 
at the time the wells were drilled, the operators did not consider it 
economically feasible to produce those hydrocarbons. Having tested oil in our 
offshore Block Z-1 in our first wells in the Corvina field in 2007, and our 
first well in Albacora in December&nbsp;2009, we are initially focusing on 
development of the proved oil reserves in those two fields. In June 2011, we 
drilled our first onshore well in Block XIX. The well tests yielded low rates of
oil to surface with high water content of low-salinity. In December 2011, we 
determined that this well had no further utility and therefore, declared the 
well a dry hole. We are planning to acquire additional seismic data before 
considering further drilling activity in this block. Our application for an 
environmental permit to conduct 3-D seismic in Block XIX is under consideration 
by the relevant authorities.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA299><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA300><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In the near term, management is focused on the drilling 
operations from the new CX-15 platform utilizing the results of the 1,600 square
kilometers (&#8220;km&#8221;) of 3-D seismic survey in Block Z-1 to optimize our
future activities in that location, and optimizing current production activities
at our current producing locations. We believe our joint venture with Pacific 
Rubiales in Block Z-1 will help accelerate exploration and development of Block 
Z-1 and unlock the value of that asset. At our onshore locations we are in the 
process of obtaining the necessary permits to continue exploration activities 
utilizing our 3-D seismic data acquired in 2011, and focusing on maximizing the 
value of the acreage we hold for exploration through possible joint ventures. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA301><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3930.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK3930 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR3930 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM3930 >S-
4</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR3930 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3930.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA302><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Credit Suisse Securities (USA) LLC is managing the formal 
process to find a joint venture partner for Blocks XIX and XXIII. The two blocks
comprise over 800,000 acres and hold both oil and gas potential, with Block 
XXIII bordering the northern part of the prolific Talara oil fields. Interested 
partners have been invited to review the data; however, we believe it will be in
our best interests to further de-risk the Block XXIII prospects by drilling up 
to three shallow exploratory wells on the large anticline identified by the 3-D 
seismic data to prove the existence of hydrocarbons before pursuing further 
partnering opportunities. We have received approval to move the previously 
agreed drilling locations to conform to the 3-D seismic results. </FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA303><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA304><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In addition, our business plan includes a gas-to-power project 
as part of our overall gas marketing strategy, which entails the installation of
a 10-mile gas pipeline from the CX-11 platform to shore, the construction of gas
processing facilities and the building of an approximately 135-megawatt 
(&#8220;MW&#8221;) simple cycle electric generating plant. The proposed power 
plant site is located adjacent to an existing substation and power transmission 
lines which, with certain upgrades, are expected to be capable of handling up to
420 MWs of power. We currently plan to wholly or partially own this power 
generation facility. The gas-to-power project is planned to generate a revenue 
stream by creating a market for the non-associated gas discovered in our Corvina
field that is currently shut-in or being reinjected. This project has not yet 
been financed and we continue to consider the best alternatives for the project.
Meanwhile, we have obtained certain permits and are in the process of obtaining 
additional permits to move forward with the project.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA305><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA306><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Oil Development</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA307><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 3pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA308><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>General</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA310>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA309><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We plan to conduct additional drilling activities based in part
on an ongoing assessment of economic efficiencies, license contract 
requirements, likely success and logistical issues, such as scheduling, required
maintenance and replacement of equipment, as well as results of the collection 
and interpretation of new 2-D and 3-D seismic data. This assessment could result
in increased emphasis and activities on a given prospect and, conversely, could 
result in decreased emphasis on a given prospect for a period of time. In 
particular, we will assess allocation of our current resources among the 
Corvina, Albacora, and other Block Z-1 prospects and certain onshore prospects 
as they develop, along with our gas-to-power project. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA311>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA312><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B><I>Block Z-1</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA313>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA314><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;<I>Divestiture</I></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA315>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA316><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The proceeds from our joint venture with Pacific Rubiales of 
$150.0 million (less transaction costs of $5.7 million), less the net book value
of the assets sold of $117.4 million, resulted in a gain on the sale of $26.9 
million that we recognized as a component of operating and administrative 
expenses in connection with the closing. Due to certain tax benefits resulting 
from the sale, the after tax gain was $31.1 million.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA318>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA317><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">At June 30, 2013 and December 31, 2012, our carry amount was 
$112.0 million and $126.3 million, respectively.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA319>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA320><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">At June 30, 2013 and December 31, 2012, we reflected $19.9 
million as other current liabilities and $20.8 million as other non-current 
liabilities for exploratory expenditures related to Block Z-1 under funding by 
Pacific Rubiales of the exploratory expenditures in Block Z-1 incurred in 2012. 
This amount will be settled by us and Pacific Rubiales under the terms of the 
SPA.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA321>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA322><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><I>Corvina Field</I></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA323>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA324><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We originally began producing oil from the CX-11 platform, 
located in the Corvina field within the offshore Block Z-1 in northwest Peru, 
under a well testing program that started on November 1, 2007. The Corvina field
was placed into commercial production on November 30, 2010. The Corvina field 
consists of approximately 47,000 acres in water depths of less than 300 feet. We
have completed a total of nine gross (4.6 net) oil wells, the CX11-23D, the 
CX11-22D, the CX11-17D, the CX11-19D, the CX11-15D, the CX11-21XD, the CX11-
20XD, the CX11-18XD and the CX11-14D wells, some of which are currently being 
used as gas injection and/or water injection wells. Produced oil is kept in 
production inventory until such time that it is delivered to the refinery. The 
oil is delivered by vessel to storage tanks at the refinery in Talara, owned by 
the Peruvian national oil company, Petroleos del Peru &#8211; PETROPERU S.A., 
which is located 70 miles south of the platform.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA325>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3931.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK3931 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR3931 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM3931 >S-
5</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR3931 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3931.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA326><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Corvina's CX-11 platform is currently producing and work is 
underway to expand the capacity of the existing injection compressor. Once the 
compressor work is completed, we may perform an additional workover designed to 
reduce associated gas production.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA327><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA328><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The buoyant CX-15 platform was anchored in the West Corvina 
field, one mile south of the existing CX-11 platform, in the second half of 
September 2012. On November 8, 2012, we received an environmental permit from 
the Direcci&#243;n General de Asuntos Ambientales Energ&#233;ticos 
(&#8220;DGAAE&#8221;) allowing us to begin the drilling and subsequent operation
of all production and injection facilities on the new CX-15 platform at the 
Corvina field. We installed three pipelines between the two Corvina platforms 
and one pipeline from the CX-15 platform to the discharge manifold for the 
floating storage and offloading vessel. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA330>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA329><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The platform monitoring and control system modifications 
necessary to facilitate operation of the CX-15 platform are complete. Equipment 
is tracking platform response to weather and ocean conditions as well as draft. 
As a precaution, an anchoring system was installed to provide redundancy to the 
spud can, which anchors the platform. In July 2013, we spudded the first 
development well from the new CX-15 platform in the Corvina field.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA331>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA332><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We are currently working on installing a Lease Automatic 
Custody Transfer (&#8220;LACT&#8221;) unit, the system for measuring the volume 
of crude oil when it is being transferred from the production site to our 
storage facility, at the Corvina field to meet the agreed date to comply with 
applicable regulations. We expect to commence operation of the LACT unit by the 
end of the third quarter of 2013 on a floating storage and offloading 
vessel.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA333>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA334><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Many of the Corvina oil wells have seen initial production 
decline rates of approximately 50% during the first year of production before 
stabilizing. Although each of the Corvina wells has declined differently, partly
due to the fact that these wells were completed in different zones and some of 
the wells encountered mechanical problems, they have all initially shown typical
solution gas drive behavior which can lead to significant production declines 
during the first year before leveling off to sustainable rates. We believe these
results are influenced by technical/mechanical problems encountered with our 
initial wells, including unintentional production from intervals in the gas cap;
however, it is possible we will see similar production declines with new Corvina
wells. The representative rates of production decline remain to be determined 
because the effective production mechanism in the Corvina field has yet to be 
fully understood, although we believe that our recent initiation of gas 
reinjection into the gas cap is helping to slow production decline rates. 
Further, our ability to produce indicated reserves in Corvina depends on our 
ability to finance our continued operations and get our produced oil to market. 
Any failure in meeting these requirements could negatively affect our indicated 
reserves and their value as reported under the SEC rules. Therefore, in the 
evaluation of reserves, we attempt to account for all possible delays we can 
reasonably predict and their impact on the production forecast and remaining 
reserves to be produced.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA336>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA335><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><I>Albacora Field</I></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA337>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA338><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Albacora field is located in the northern part of our 
offshore Block Z-1 in northwest Peru. The current area of interest within the 
Albacora field is located in water depths of less than 200 feet. We have 
completed a total of four gross (2.0 net) oil wells. We produced oil from the 
Albacora field from December 2009 through late October 2012 under various 
extended well testing permits.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA339>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA340><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Installation of the Albacora gas and water reinjection 
equipment was completed and the equipment was ready for reinjection to begin 
early in the first quarter of 2012. We received the required environmental 
permit for gas and produced water injection on October 29, 2012. Accordingly, 
the Albacora field is no longer subject to an extended well testing program and 
the gas and water reinjection equipment is now operating in a routine manner. We
intend to mobilize a drilling rig and reinitiate the development drilling 
program at Albacora, guided by the 3-D seismic we obtained over the 
field.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA341>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3932.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK3932 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR3932 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM3932 >S-
6</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR3932 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3932.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA342><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><I>Block Z-1 Seismic</I></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA343>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA344><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We completed the 3-D seismic survey of the area to assess our 
prospects before conducting further drilling operations, as well as to comply 
with our exploration commitments under our license contract. On November 3, 
2011, we received the environmental permit to acquire approximately 1,600 square
kms of 3-D seismic data in our offshore Block Z-1 that was granted by the DGAAE.
The seismic survey began in the first quarter of 2012. A second seismic boat was
contracted to acquire the remaining areas where the CGGVeritas Vantage vessel 
was unable to safely navigate. The 3-D seismic acquisition on the remaining 
areas of Block Z-1 commenced in September 2012, with completion in February 
2013. Fugro Seismic Services recently completed processing the seismic data 
acquired to date. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA345>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA346><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The joint technical team continues to interpret the Block Z-1 
3-D seismic data we have recently acquired.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA347>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA348><B><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><I>Block XIX</I></FONT></B><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA349>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA350><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We have received approval from Perupetro to conduct a limited 
3-D seismic survey as part of our minimum work commitment for the fourth 
exploration period to further evaluate future drilling locations. An 
environmental assessment is currently being prepared to obtain an environmental 
permit for the additional seismic work.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA351>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA352><B><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><I>Block XXII</I></FONT></B><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA353>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA354><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As a result of the 258 kms of 2-D seismic survey completed in 
2011, three prospects and one lead have been defined. Evaluation continues and 
we expect to develop a detailed assessment of each prospect in order to define 
their technical merit and risk to determine their exploration potential. We plan
to conduct an additional 2-D seismic program in 2013 as confirmation of 
potential drilling locations, and plan to drill exploratory wells after receipt 
of the necessary environmental permits.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA355>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA356><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We have notified Perupetro that the commitment for the second 
exploration period will be the drilling of one well. The timing of the actual 
drilling will depend on approval of the environmental permit, which is currently
being prepared, and subsequent receipt of the necessary ancillary permits. 
Drilling on Block XXII is expected no earlier than 2014.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA357>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA358><B><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><I>Block XXIII</I></FONT></B><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA359>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA360><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In 2011 we acquired approximately 370 square kms of 3-D seismic
data and 312 kms of 2-D seismic data, which included certain areas of interest 
within the Palo Santo region and four other prospects that are a part of the 
Mancora gas play. The processing of the 3-D and 2-D data of Block XXIII has been
completed and evaluated.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA361>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA362><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The environmental permits for the drilling of several prospects
identified by the 2-D and 3-D seismic data acquired in 2011 on Block XXIII was
approved in January 2013. We requested and have&nbsp;received&nbsp;approval from
the DGAAE to move the previously agreed drilling locations to conform to the 3-D
seismic results.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA363>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA364><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We are now in the second exploration period. Drilling on Block 
XXIII is expected near year end 2013.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA365>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA366><B><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><I>Gas-to-Power Project</I></FONT></B><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, 
Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA367>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA368><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our gas-to-power project entails the installation of an 
approximately 10-mile gas pipeline from the CX-11 platform to shore, the 
construction of gas processing facilities and a 135 MW net simple-cycle power 
generation facility. The proposed power plant site is located adjacent to an 
existing substation near Zorritos and a 220 kilovolt transmission line which, 
after the Peruvian government completes its expansion, is expected to be capable
of handling up to 420 MW of power. The existing substation and transmission 
lines are owned and operated by third parties.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA369>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA370><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In order to support our proposed electric generation project, 
we commissioned an independent power market analysis for the region. The 
Peruvian electricity market is deregulated and power is transported through an 
interconnected national grid managed by the Comit&#233; de Operaci&#243;n 
Econ&#243;mica del Sistema Interconectado Nacional. Based on this study, we 
believe we will be able to sell, under contract, economic quantities of 
electricity from the initial 135 MW power plant. The market study also indicates
that there may be future opportunities for us to generate and sell significantly
greater volumes of power into the Peruvian and possibly Ecuadorian power 
markets. Accordingly, the revenues from the natural gas delivered to the power 
plant will be derived from the sale of electricity.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA371>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3933.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK3933 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR3933 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM3933 >S-
7</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR3933 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3933.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA372><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We currently estimate the gas-to-power project will cost 
approximately $153.5 million, excluding capitalized interest, working capital 
and 18% value-added tax which will be recovered via future revenue billings. The
$153.5 million includes $133.5 million for the estimated cost of the power plant
and $20.0 million for the natural gas pipeline. While we have held initial 
discussions with several potential joint venture partners for the gas-to-power 
project in an attempt to secure additional financing and other resources for the
project, we have not entered into any definitive agreements with a potential 
partner. In the event we are able to identify and reach an agreement with a 
potential joint venture partner, we may only retain a minority position in the 
project. However, we, along with our Block Z-1 partner, expect to retain the 
responsibility for the construction and ownership of the pipeline. We have 
obtained certain permits and are in the process of obtaining additional permits
to move the project forward.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA373>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA374><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Recent Developments</B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA375>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA376><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><I>Albacora Field</I></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA377>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA378><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Drilling preparations continue to reinitiate the Albacora field
drilling campaign. Some platform work to accommodate the drilling rig was 
required and the weather conditions in July caused delays. The first spudding at
the Albacora field is now expected by late September or early 
October.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA379>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA380><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><I>$40.0 Million Secured Debt Facility</I></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA382>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA381><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We currently intend to use cash on hand to pay off the 
outstanding debt under our $40.0 million secured debt facility. We currently 
know of no reason that we cannot or will not pay off the $40.0 million secured 
debt facility from available funds based on our expected current cash position 
following this offering. Should we not pay off the $40.0 million secured debt 
facility as intended, it may become necessary to seek waivers for certain 
performance covenants based on quarterly targets.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA383>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA384><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><I>Regulatory Developments</I></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA385>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA386><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In May 2013, the Peruvian government enacted several Supreme 
Decrees that approve special provisions to speed up administrative procedures, 
special provisions for the performance of administrative procedures and other 
measures to encourage private and public investment projects, and declared it is
of national interest and priority to promote and accelerate investments in Peru.
These provisions establish reduced time periods for obtaining approvals to 
protect archaeological, water and other environmental resources, including 
approval of Environmental Impact Studies. These new measures are expected to 
speed up the hydrocarbon investments in the existing license contracts for the 
exploration and exploitation of hydrocarbons in Peru. We cannot, however, 
predict the actual effectiveness or benefits of these new measures. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA387>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA388><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Company Offices</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA389><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA390><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our principle executive offices are located at 580 Westlake 
Park Boulevard, Suite&nbsp;525, Houston, Texas 77079 and our telephone number is
(281) 556-6200. Our website address is <I>www.bpzenergy.com</I>. Information 
contained on our website does not constitute part of this prospectus 
supplement.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA391.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK391 >

noShade>

<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA391.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA392><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>THE OFFERING</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA393><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA394><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><I>The following summary contains basic information about this 
offering and the notes and is not intended to be complete. It does not contain 
all of the information that may be important to you. For a more complete 
understanding of all of the terms and provisions of the notes, please see 
&#8220;Description of Notes&#8221; in this prospectus supplement and 
&#8220;Description of Debt Securities&#8221; in the accompanying prospectus. 
</I></FONT></P>

<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA414><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Interest</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 2.1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom">&nbsp; </TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 56.9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA415><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">The notes will bear interest at a rate of 8.50% per annum. We will pay 
interest on the notes semi-annually, in arrears, on April&nbsp;1 and 
October&nbsp;1 of each year, commencing April 1, 2014.</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&nbsp; </TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 2.1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom">&nbsp; </TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 56.9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&nbsp; </TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA416><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Ranking</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 2.1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 56.9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA417><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">The notes will constitute our senior unsecured debt. They 
will:</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 2.1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 56.9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 2.1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom">&nbsp; </TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 56.9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 37.05pt" id=PARA418><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 
</FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">rank equally in right of payment with all of our existing and 
future senior unsecured debt;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 37.05pt" id=PARA419><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 
</FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">rank senior in right of payment to all of our existing and 
future subordinated debt;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 37.05pt" id=PARA420><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 
</FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">be effectively junior to our existing and future secured debt 
to the extent of the value of the assets securing such debt; and </FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 37.05pt" id=PARA421><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 
</FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">be structurally subordinated to all of the existing and future 
liabilities of each of our subsidiaries. </FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 2.1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 56.9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 2.1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 56.9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 1.05pt" 
id=PARA422><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif;
FONT-SIZE: 10pt">At June 30, 2013, we had $197.1 million of consolidated 
outstanding indebtedness, of which approximately $40 million was secured 
indebtedness outstanding under our credit facility that&nbsp;is senior to the 
notes. After giving effect to the issuance of the notes,&nbsp;assuming no 
exercise of the underwriter&#8217;s option to purchase additional notes and the 
use of proceeds therefrom, our total consolidated indebtedness would have been 
$227.4 million. </FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&nbsp; </TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 2.1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom">&nbsp; </TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 56.9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&nbsp; </TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA423><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Conversion Rights</B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 2.1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 56.9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA424><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">Holders may convert their notes at any time prior to the close of business
on the second business day immediately preceding the maturity date, in multiples
of $1,000, at the holder&#8217;s option, under any of the following 
circumstances:</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 2.1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 56.9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 41%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 2.1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom">&nbsp; </TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 56.9%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 36pt" id=PARA425><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif,
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">during any fiscal quarter (and only during that fiscal quarter) commencing
after October 1, 2013, if the last reported sale price of our common stock is 
greater than or equal to 130% of the conversion price (as defined herein) for at
least 20 trading days in the 30-day consecutive trading day period ending on the
last trading day of the preceding fiscal quarter;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 36pt" id=PARA426><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif,
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">prior to July 1, 2017, during any five business-day period after any ten 
consecutive trading-day period (the &#8220;measurement period&#8221;) in which 
the trading price per $1,000 principal amount of notes for each trading day in 
the measurement period was less than 97% of the product of the last reported 
sale price of our common stock and the conversion rate (as defined herein) on 
such trading day; or</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 36pt" id=PARA427><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif,
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">upon the occurrence of specified corporate transactions described under 
&#8220;Description of Notes&#8212;Conversion rights&#8212;Conversion upon 
specified corporate transactions.&#8221; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA3934>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA3935.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK3935 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR3935 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM3935 >S-
9</DIV>
