<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA754><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">a cyber-
attack on a vendor or service provider could result in supply chain disruptions 
which could delay or halt one of our major projects, effectively delaying the 
start of cash flows from the project; </FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB756  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 37pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA757><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#9679;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA758><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">a cyber-
attack involving commodities exchanges or financial institutions could slow or 
halt commodities trading, thus preventing us from marketing our production or 
engaging in hedging activities, resulting in a loss of revenues; 
</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB760  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 37pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA761><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#9679;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA762><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">a cyber-
attack on a communications network or power grid could cause operational 
disruption resulting in loss of revenues; </FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB764  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 37pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA765><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#9679;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA766><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">a 
deliberate corruption of our financial or operational data could result in 
events of non-compliance which could lead to regulatory fines or penalties; and
</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB768  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 37pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA769><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#9679;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA770><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">significant
business interruptions could result in expensive remediation efforts, 
distraction of management, damage to our reputation, or a negative impact on the
price of our common stock.</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA771><FONT 
id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 
0pt" id=PARA772><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Although to date we have not 
experienced any material losses relating to cyber incidents, there can be no 
assurance that we will not suffer such losses in the future. As cyber threats 
continue to evolve, we may be required to expend significant additional 
resources to continue to modify or enhance our protective measures or to 
investigate and remediate any information security vulnerabilities. 
</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 40pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA773><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 
0pt" id=PARA774><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>The loss of senior management 
or key technical personnel could adversely affect us.</I></B> We have engaged 
certain members of management who have substantial expertise in the type of 
endeavors we presently conduct and the geographical areas in which we conduct 
them. We do not maintain any life insurance against the loss of any of these 
individuals. To the extent their services become unavailable, we will be 
required to retain other qualified personnel. There can be no assurance we will 
be able to recruit and hire qualified persons on acceptable terms.&nbsp; 
Similarly, the oil and gas exploration industry requires the use of personnel 
with substantial technical expertise. In the event that the services of our 
current technical personnel become unavailable, we will need to hire qualified 
personnel to take their place. No assurance can be given that we will be able to
recruit and hire such persons on acceptable terms.&nbsp; Inability to replace 
lost members of management or key technical personnel may adversely affect 
us.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 40pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA775><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 
0pt" id=PARA776><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Insurance does not cover all 
risks.</I></B> Exploration for, and the production of, oil and natural gas can 
be hazardous, involving unforeseen occurrences such as blowouts, cratering, 
fires and loss of well control, which can result in (i) damage to or destruction
of wells and/or production facilities, (ii) damage to or destruction of 
formations, (iii) injury to persons, (iv) loss of life, or (v) damage to 
property, the environment or natural resources. As a result, we presently 
maintain insurance coverage in amounts consistent with our business activities
and to the extent required by our license contracts. Such insurance coverage 
includes certain physical damage to our and third parties&#8217; property, hull 
and machinery, protection and indemnity, employer&#8217;s liability, 
comprehensive third party general liability, workers&#8217; compensation and 
certain pollution and environmental risks. However, we are not fully insured 
against all risks in all aspects of our business, such as political risk, civil 
unrest, war, business interruption, environmental damage and reservoir loss or 
damage. Further, no such insurance coverage can insure for all operational or 
environmental risks. The occurrence of an event that is not insured or not fully
insured could result in losses to us. For example, uninsured or under insured 
environmental damages, property damages or damages related to personal injuries 
could divert capital needed to implement our plan of operation. If any such 
uninsured losses are significant, we may have to curtail or suspend our drilling
or other operations until such time as replacement capital is obtained, if ever,
and this could have a material adverse impact on our financial position. 
</FONT></FONT></P></FONT></FONT>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA4132.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK4132 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR4132 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM4132 >S-
23</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR4132 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA4132.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 
0pt" id=PARA772>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 
0pt" id=PARA776><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></FONT></FONT></P><FONT 
id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6520></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA778><FONT 
id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B>Risk Factors Related to the Notes and the Underlying 
Shares of Common Stock</B></FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA779><FONT 
id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA780><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>The notes are unsecured, are 
effectively subordinated to all of our existing and future secured indebtedness 
(to the extent of the assets securing such indebtedness) and are structurally 
subordinated to all liabilities of our subsidiaries, including trade payables. 
</I></B>The notes are unsecured, are effectively subordinated to all of our 
existing and future secured indebtedness, to the extent of the assets securing 
such indebtedness, and are structurally subordinated to all liabilities of our 
subsidiaries, including trade payables. As of June 30, 2013, we had 
approximately $197.1 million of consolidated outstanding indebtedness, of which 
approximately $40.0 million was secured indebtedness outstanding under our 
credit facilities that is senior to the notes. After giving effect to the 
issuance of the notes (assuming no exercise of underwriter&#8217;s option to 
purchase additional notes) and the use of proceeds therefrom, our total 
consolidated indebtedness would have been $227.4 million. In addition, as of 
June 30, 2013, in connection with our properties in Peru, we have obtained 
performance bonds totaling $5.7 million that are partially collateralized by 
restricted cash deposits of $3.5 million to insure certain performance 
obligations and commitments under the license contracts for Blocks Z-1, XIX, 
XXII and XXIII. In the event of our insolvency, bankruptcy, liquidation, 
reorganization, dissolution or winding up, we may not have sufficient assets to 
pay amounts due on any or all of the notes then outstanding. See
&#8220;Description of Notes&#8212;Ranking.&#8221; </FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA781><FONT 
id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA782><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">None of our subsidiaries has 
guaranteed or otherwise become obligated with respect to the notes. Our right to
receive assets from any of our subsidiaries upon its liquidation or 
reorganization, and the right of holders of the notes to participate in those 
assets, is structurally subordinated to claims of that subsidiary&#8217;s 
creditors, including trade creditors. Even if we were a creditor of any of our 
subsidiaries, our rights as a creditor would be subordinate to any security 
interest in the assets of that subsidiary and any indebtedness of that 
subsidiary senior to that held by us. Furthermore, none of our subsidiaries is 
under any obligation to make payments to us, and any payments to us would depend
on the earnings or financial condition of our subsidiaries and various business 
considerations. Statutory, contractual or other restrictions may also limit our 
subsidiaries&#8217; ability to pay dividends or make distributions, loans or 
advances to us. For these reasons, we may not have access to any assets or cash 
flows of our subsidiaries to make payments on the notes.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA783><FONT 
id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA784><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Increased leverage as a result 
of this offering may harm our financial condition and results of operations. 
</I></B>As adjusted to include the sale of the notes we are offering, our total 
consolidated long-term debt as of June 30, 2013 would have been approximately 
$227.4&nbsp;million (net of a preliminary discount on the notes of approximately
$23.5 million) and would have represented approximately&nbsp;59.0% of our total 
capitalization as of that date.&nbsp;Brokerage fees were 
$7.6&nbsp;million.&nbsp;The indenture for the notes will not restrict our 
ability to incur additional indebtedness. Our level of indebtedness could have 
important consequences to you, because: </FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA785><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB787  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM:

FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#9679;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA789><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">it could 
affect our ability to satisfy our obligations under the 
notes;</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB791  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>

<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA793><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">a 
substantial portion of our cash flows from operations will be dedicated to 
interest and principal payments and may not be available for operations, working
capital, capital expenditures, expansion, acquisitions or general corporate or 
other purposes;</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB795  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM:

<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">

0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA797><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">it may 
impair our ability to obtain additional financing in the future; 
</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB799  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA800><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#9679;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA801><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">it may 
limit our flexibility in planning for, or reacting to, changes in our business 
and industry;</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB803  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA804><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#9679;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA805><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">it may make
us more vulnerable to downturns in our business, our industry or the economy in 
general; and</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB807  border=0 cellSpacing=0
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA808><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#9679;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA809><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">otherwise 
limit our ability to realize the value of our 
assets.</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
5.05pt 0pt 54pt" id=PARA810><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA811><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If we fail to make a payment on the 
notes, we could be in default on the notes, and this default could cause us to 
be in default on our other outstanding indebtedness. Conversely, a default on 
our other outstanding indebtedness may cause a default under the 
notes.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA812><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 
0pt" id=PARA813><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Investor profits, if any, may 
be limited for the near future.</I></B> In the past, we have never paid a 
dividend. We do not anticipate paying any dividends in the near future. 
Accordingly, investors in our common stock may not derive any profits from their
investment in us for the foreseeable future, other than through any price 
appreciation of our common stock that may occur. Further, any appreciation in 
the price of our common stock may be limited or nonexistent as long as we 
continue to have operating losses. We have not been profitable and have 
accumulated a deficit of operations totaling $406.3 million through June 30, 
2013.&nbsp; To date we have had limited revenue and no earnings from operations.
&nbsp;There can be no assurances that sufficient revenue to cover total expenses
can be achieved until, if at all, we fully implement our operational 
plan.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA814><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 
0pt" id=PARA815><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Additional infusions of capital
may have a dilutive effect on existing shareholders.</I></B> To finance our 
operations, we may sell additional shares of our common stock.&nbsp; During the 
first quarter of 2010, we issued $170.9 million of Convertible Notes that mature
in 2015 that, if converted to common stock, could significantly increase the 
amount of our common shares outstanding by up to approximately 28.9&nbsp;million
shares. &nbsp;We currently have $134.6 million in common stock available under 
an effective shelf registration statement, and another $500.0 million available 
under the same shelf registration statement for debt securities, common stock, 
preferred stock, depositary shares and securities warrants, subscription rights,
units, and guarantees of debt securities or any combination thereof, which we 
may sell from time to time in one or more offerings pursuant to underwritten 
public offerings, negotiated transactions, at the market transactions, block 
trades or a combination of these methods. Our certificate of formation does not 
provide for preemptive rights, although by contract we have granted the
International Finance Corporation (&#8220;IFC&#8221;) the right to purchase 
shares of our common stock to retain its proportionate ownership pursuant to the
Subscription Agreement dated December 16, 2006 by and between IFC and us.&nbsp; 
Any additional equity financing that we receive may involve substantial dilution
to our then-existing shareholders. Furthermore, we may issue common stock to 
acquire properties, assets, or businesses. In the event that any such shares are
issued, the proportionate ownership and voting power of other shareholders will 
be reduced. In addition, we are authorized to issue up to 25,000,000 shares of 
preferred stock, the rights and preferences of which may be designated by our 
Board of Directors. If we issue shares of preferred stock, such preferred stock 
may have rights and preferences that are superior to those of our common 
stock.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA816><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK4133 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR4133 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM4133 >S-
24</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR4133 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" 
id=PARA4133.2>&nbsp;</P></FONT></FONT>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA817><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Our operations may not generate
sufficient cash to enable us to service our debt, including the notes. 
</I></B>Our future cash flow may be insufficient to meet our debt obligations 
and commitments. Any insufficiency could negatively impact our business. A range
of economic, competitive, business and industry factors will affect our future 
financial performance, and, as a result, our ability to generate cash flow from 
operations and to pay our debt, including the notes. Many of these factors, such
as oil and gas prices, economic and financial conditions in our industry and the
global economy or competitive initiatives of our competitors, are beyond our 
control.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA818><FONT 
id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA819><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If we do not generate enough cash 
flow from operations to satisfy our debt obligations, we may have to undertake 
alternative financing plans, such as: </FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA820><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB822  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM:

FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#9679;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA824><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">refinancing
or restructuring our debt;</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB826  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

assets; </FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,

<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">

<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">

0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA832><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">reducing or
delaying capital investments; or</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,

cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM:

<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">

0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA836><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">seeking to 
raise additional capital.</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 5.05pt 0pt 0pt" 
id=PARA837><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA838><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">However, any alternative financing 
plans that we undertake, if necessary, may not allow us to meet our debt 
obligations. Our inability to generate sufficient cash flow to satisfy our debt 
obligations, including our obligations under the notes, or to obtain alternative
financing, could materially and adversely affect our business, financial 
condition, results of operations and prospects.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA839><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA840><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Volatility of the market price 
of our common stock may depress the trading price of the notes. </I></B>The 
market price of our common stock may be highly volatile and subject to wide 
fluctuations. In addition, the trading volume in our common stock may fluctuate 
and cause significant price variations to occur. Because the notes are 
convertible into, and based upon the price of, our common stock, volatility in 
the price of our common stock may depress the trading price of the notes. The 
risk of volatility and depressed prices of our common stock also applies to 
holders who receive shares of our common stock upon conversion of their 
notes.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA841><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA842><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We cannot assure you that the market 
price of our common stock will not fluctuate or decline significantly in the 
future. Some of the factors that could adversely affect our share price or 
result in fluctuations in the price or trading volume of our common stock 
include:</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA843><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>

</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,

<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM:

<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA867><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">general 
market and economic conditions.</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
5.05pt 0pt 54pt" id=PARA868><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA869><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Because we are in the early stages of
developing our oil and natural gas reserves, these market fluctuations may be 
more significant for us than they would be for a company with a longer operating
history. In addition, the stock market has experienced in the past, and may in 
the future experience extreme price and volume fluctuations. These market 
fluctuations may materially and adversely affect the trading price of our common
stock, regardless of our actual operating performance.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA870><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA871><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">These factors, among others, could 
significantly depress the trading price of the notes and the price of our common
stock, if any, issued upon conversion of the notes.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA872><FONT 
id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA873><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>A fundamental change may 
adversely affect us or the notes. </I></B>You may have the right to require us 
to repurchase your notes upon the occurrence of a fundamental change as 
described in &#8220;Description of Notes&#8212;Fundamental change permits 
holders to require us to purchase notes.&#8221; Future debt we may incur may 
limit our ability to repurchase the notes upon a fundamental change. Also, if a 
fundamental change occurs, we cannot assure you that we will have enough funds 
to repurchase all the notes.</FONT></FONT></P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK4134 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR4134 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM4134 >S-
25</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR4134 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA4134.2><FONT 
id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA875><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Furthermore, the fundamental change 
provisions, including the provisions requiring us to increase the conversion 
rate by a number of additional shares related to conversions in connection with 
a fundamental change, may in certain circumstances make more difficult or 
discourage a takeover of our company and the removal of incumbent 
management.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA876><FONT 
id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA877><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Future sales of our common 
stock or the issuance of other equity may adversely affect the market price of 
our common stock and the value of the notes. </I></B>Sales of our common stock 
or other equity-related securities could depress the market price of the notes, 
our common stock, or both, and impair our ability to raise capital through the 
sale of additional equity securities. We cannot predict the effect that future 
sales of our common stock or other equity-related securities would have on the 
market price of our common stock or the value of the notes. The price of our 
common stock could be affected by possible sales of our common stock by 
investors who view the notes as a more attractive means of equity participation 
in our company and by hedging or arbitrage trading activity that we expect to
develop involving our common stock. The hedging or arbitrage could, in turn, 
affect the market price of the notes.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA878><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA879><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>The conditional conversion 
feature of the notes could result in your receiving less than the value of the 
common stock or cash and common stock, as applicable, into which a note would 
otherwise be convertible. </I></B>Prior to July 1, 2017, the notes are 
convertible only if specified conditions are met. If the specific conditions for
conversion are not met, you will not be able to convert your notes, and you may 
not be able to receive the value of the common stock or cash and common stock, 
as applicable, into which the notes would otherwise be 
convertible.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA880><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA881><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Upon conversion of the notes, 
we may pay a settlement amount consisting of cash and shares of our common 
stock, if any, based upon a specified period of 20 trading days. </I></B>If we 
elect to settle our conversion obligation in cash and common stock, if any, or 
if we waive our right to satisfy our conversion obligation solely in shares of 
our common stock, we will be required to satisfy our conversion obligation to 
holders by paying cash, up to the principal amount of notes to be converted, and
by delivering shares of our common stock with respect to the excess conversion 
value of the notes to be converted determined using the applicable stock price. 
Accordingly, upon conversion of a note, holders might not receive any shares of 
our common stock, or they might receive fewer shares of common stock relative to
the conversion value of the note as of the conversion date. In addition, because
of the 20 trading-day period relevant to determining the applicable stock price,
settlement will be delayed until at least the 23rd trading day following the 
related conversion date (and possibly later). See &#8220;Description of 
Notes&#8212;Conversion procedures&#8212;Payment upon conversion.&#8221; Upon 
conversion of the notes, you may receive less proceeds than expected because the
value of our common stock may decline (or not appreciate as much as you may 
expect) between the conversion date and the day the settlement amount of your 
notes is determined.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA882><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA883><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>The notes are not protected by 
restrictive covenants. </I></B>The indenture governing the notes does not 
contain any financial or operating covenants or restrictions on the payments of 
dividends, the incurrence of indebtedness or the issuance or repurchase of 
securities by us or our subsidiary. The indenture contains no covenants or other
provisions to afford protection to holders of the notes in the event of a 
fundamental change involving us except to the extent described under 
&#8220;Description of Notes&#8212;Fundamental change permits holders to require 
us to purchase notes,&#8221; and &#8220;Description of Notes&#8212;Conversion 
rights&#8212;Conversion rate adjustments&#8212;Adjustment to shares delivered 
upon conversion upon make-whole fundamental change.&#8221;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA884><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA885><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>The adjustment to the 
conversion rate for notes converted in connection with a make-whole fundamental
change may not adequately compensate you for any lost value of your notes as a 
result of such transaction. </I></B>If a make-whole fundamental change occurs 
prior to October 1, 2017 we will, under certain circumstances, increase the 
conversion rate by a number of additional shares of our common stock for notes 
converted in connection with the make-whole fundamental change. The increase in 
the conversion rate will be determined based on the date on which the specified 
corporate transaction becomes effective and the price paid per share of our 
common stock in such transaction, as described below under &#8220;Description of
Notes&#8212;Conversion rights&#8212;Conversion rate 
adjustments&#8212;Adjustments to shares delivered upon conversion upon certain 
fundamental changes.&#8221; The adjustment to the conversion rate for notes 
converted in connection with a make-whole fundamental change may not adequately 
compensate you for any lost value of your notes as a result of such transaction.
In addition, if the price of our common stock in the transaction is greater than
$12.00 per share or less than $2.29 (in each case, subject to adjustment), no 
adjustment will be made to the conversion rate. In addition, in no event will 
the total number of shares of common stock issuable upon conversion as a result 
of this adjustment exceed 436.7346 shares per $1,000 principal amount of notes, 
subject to adjustments in the same manner as the base conversion rate as set 
forth under &#8220;Description of Notes&#8212;Conversion rights&#8212;Conversion
rate adjustments.&#8221; </FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA886><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA887><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our obligation to increase the 
conversion rate in connection with any make-whole fundamental change could be 
considered a penalty, in which case the enforceability thereof would be subject 
to general principles of reasonableness of economic remedies.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA888><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA889><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>The conversion rate of the 
notes may not be adjusted for all dilutive events. </I></B>The conversion rate 
of the notes is subject to adjustment only for certain specified events, 
including, but not limited to, the issuance of stock dividends on our common 
stock, the issuance of certain rights or warrants, subdivisions, combinations, 
distributions of capital stock, indebtedness, or assets, cash dividends and 
certain issuer tender or exchange offers as described under &#8220;Description 
of Notes&#8212;Conversion rights&#8212;Conversion rate adjustments.&#8221; 
However, the conversion rate will not be adjusted for other events, such as a 
third party tender or exchange offer or an issuance of common stock for cash, 
that may adversely affect the trading price of the notes or the common 
stock.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA4135.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK4135 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR4135 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM4135 >S-
26</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR4135 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA890><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA891><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Some significant restructuring 
transactions may not constitute a fundamental change, in which case we would not
be obligated to offer to repurchase the notes. </I></B>Upon the occurrence of a
fundamental change, you have the right to require us to repurchase your notes. 
See &#8220;Description of Notes&#8212;Fundamental change permits holders to 
require us to purchase notes.&#8221; However, the fundamental change provisions 
will not afford protection to holders of notes in the event of certain 
transactions. For example, transactions such as leveraged recapitalizations, 
refinancings, restructurings, or acquisitions initiated by us may not constitute
a fundamental change requiring us to repurchase the notes. In the event of any 
such transaction, the holders would not have the right to require us to 
repurchase the notes, even though each of these transactions could increase the 
amount of our indebtedness, or otherwise adversely affect our capital structure 
or any credit ratings, thereby adversely affecting the holders of 
notes.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA892><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA893><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>You may be subject to tax if we
make or fail to make one of certain adjustments to the conversion rate of the 
notes, even though you do not receive a corresponding cash distribution. 
</I></B>The conversion rate of the notes is subject to adjustment in certain 
circumstances, including the payment of cash dividends. If the conversion rate 
is adjusted as a result of a distribution that is taxable to our common 
stockholders, such as a cash dividend, you may be deemed to have received a 
dividend subject to United States federal income tax without the receipt of any 
cash. In addition, a failure to adjust (or to adjust adequately) the conversion 
rate after an event that increases your proportionate interest in us could be 
treated as a deemed taxable dividend to you. If a make-whole fundamental change 
occurs on or prior to the maturity date of the notes, under some circumstances, 
we will increase the conversion rate for notes converted in connection with the 
make-whole fundamental change. Such increases may also be treated as a 
distribution subject to United States Federal Income Tax as a dividend. See 
&#8220;Material United States Federal Income Tax Considerations.&#8221; If you 
are a non-U.S. holder (as defined in &#8220;Material United States Federal 
Income Tax Considerations&#8221;), any deemed dividend may be subject to United 
States federal withholding tax at a 30% rate, or such lower rate as may be 
specified by an applicable treaty. Any withholding tax on such a deemed dividend
may be withheld from interest, shares of common stock or sales proceeds 
subsequently paid or credited to you. See &#8220;Material United States Federal 
Income Tax Considerations.&#8221;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA894><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA895><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>If you hold notes, you are not 
entitled to any rights with respect to our common stock, but you are subject to 
all changes made with respect to our common stock. </I></B>If you hold notes, 
you are not entitled to any rights with respect to our common stock (including, 
without limitation, voting rights and rights to receive any dividends or other 
distributions on our common stock), but you are subject to all changes affecting
the common stock. You will only be entitled to rights on the common stock if and
when we deliver shares of common stock to you upon conversion of your notes and 
in limited cases under the anti-dilution adjustments of the notes. For example, 
in the event that an amendment is proposed to our certificate of incorporation 
or by-laws requiring stockholder approval and the record date for determining 
the stockholders of record entitled to vote on the amendment occurs prior to 
delivery of the common stock, you will not be entitled to vote on the amendment,
although you will nevertheless be subject to any changes in the powers, 
preferences or special rights of our common stock.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA896><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA897><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>The fundamental change purchase
feature of the notes may delay or prevent an otherwise beneficial takeover 
attempt of our company. </I></B>The terms of the notes require us to purchase 
the notes for cash in the event of a fundamental change. A takeover of our 
company may trigger the requirement that we purchase the notes. 
</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA898><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA899><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This may have the effect of delaying 
or preventing a takeover of our company that would otherwise be beneficial to 
investors. See also &#8220;&#8212;Our corporate organizational documents and the
provisions of Texas law to which we are subject may delay or prevent a change in
control of us that some shareholders may favor.&#8221;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA900><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA901><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Conversion of the notes may 
dilute the ownership interest of existing stockholders, including holders who 
have previously converted their notes. </I></B>The conversion of the notes may 
dilute the ownership interests of existing stockholders, including holders who 
have previously converted their notes. Any sales in the public market of our 
common stock issuable upon such conversion could adversely affect prevailing 
market prices of our common stock.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA902><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA903><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>The accounting method for 
convertible debt securities that may be settled in cash, such as the notes, 
could have a material effect on our reported financial results. 
</I></B>Generally accepted accounting principles (&#8220;GAAP&#8221;) require 
that an entity separately account for the liability and equity components of the
convertible debt instruments (such as the notes) that may be settled entirely or
partially in cash upon conversion in a manner that reflects the issuer&#8217;s 
economic interest cost. The effect on the accounting for the notes is that the 
equity component would be included in shareholders&#8217; equity on our 
consolidated balance sheet and the value of the equity component would be 
treated as original issue discount for purposes of accounting for the debt 
component of the notes. As a result, we will be required to record a greater 
amount of non-cash interest expense in current periods presented as a result of 
the amortization of the discounted carrying value of the notes to their face 
amount over the term of the notes. To date, we have capitalized a portion of 
interest expense to construction &#8211; work-in-progress under the successful 
efforts method of accounting. However, we may report lower net income in our 
financial results because GAAP requires interest to include both the current 
period&#8217;s amortization of the debt discount and the instrument&#8217;s 
coupon interest, which could adversely affect our reported or future financial 
results, the trading price of our common stock and the trading price of the 
notes.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 
0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK4136 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR4136 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM4136 >S-
27</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR4136 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA904><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA905><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>We may not have the ability to 
raise the funds to pay interest on the notes, to purchase the notes upon a 
fundamental change or to pay cash due upon conversion or repurchase of the 
notes. </I></B>The notes bear interest semi-annually at a rate of 8.50% per 
year. In addition, we may in certain circumstances be obligated to pay 
additional interest. If a fundamental change occurs, holders of the notes may 
require us to repurchase, for cash, all or a portion of their notes. In 
addition, upon conversion of the notes, if we have elected to deliver cash in 
respect of all or a portion of our conversion obligation (other than solely cash
in lieu of fractional shares), we will be required to pay cash in respect of all
or a portion of our conversion obligation. We may not have sufficient funds to 
pay the interest, repurchase price or cash in respect of our conversion 
obligation when due. If we fail to pay interest on the notes, repurchase the 
notes or pay any cash payment due upon conversion when required, we will be in 
default under the indenture governing the notes. See &#8220;Description of 
Notes&#8212;Holders may require us to repurchase their notes upon a fundamental 
change&#8221; and &#8220;Description of Notes&#8212;Events of 
default.&#8221;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 
0pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I></I></B></FONT></FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 
0pt"><FONT size=+0><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>You may find it difficult to sell your 
notes. </I></B>Although the underwriter has indicated that it intends to make a 
market in the notes, it is not obligated to do so and any of their market making
activities may be terminated or limited at any time. In addition, although we 
have registered the offer and sale of the notes under the Securities Act of 
1933, as amended (the &#8220;Securities Act&#8221;), there can be no assurance 
as to the liquidity of markets for the notes, the ability of noteholders to sell
their notes or the prices at which notes could be sold. The notes may trade at 
prices that are lower than their initial purchase price depending on many 
factors, including prevailing interest rates and the markets for similar 
securities. The liquidity of trading markets for the notes may also be adversely
affected by general declines or disruptions in the markets for debt securities. 
Those market declines or disruptions could adversely affect the liquidity of and
market for the notes independent of our financial performance or prospects. An 
active market for the notes may not exist or develop or, if developed, may not 
continue. In the absence of an active trading market, you may not be able to 
transfer the notes within the time or at the price you desire. 
</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA908><FONT 
id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA909><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>If an active and liquid trading
market for the notes does not develop, the market price of the notes may decline
and you may be unable to sell your notes. </I></B>The notes are a new issue of 
securities for which there is currently no public market. We do not intend to 
list the notes on any securities exchange or to arrange for their quotation on 
any interdealer quotation system. An active trading market may not develop for 
the notes. Even if a trading market for the notes develops, the market may not 
be liquid. If an active trading market does not develop, you may be unable to 
resell your notes or may only be able to sell them at a substantial 
discount.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA910><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA911><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>We may invest or spend the 
proceeds in this offering in ways with which you may not agree and in ways that 
may not earn a profit. </I></B>We intend to use the net proceeds from this 
offering to repurchase and retire a portion of our existing 6.50% Notes, and the
remaining net proceeds for general corporate purposes, including to fund our 
exploration and production efforts, but we may also choose to dedicate some of 
the proceeds to use in our gas-to-power project or to reduce or refinance our 
outstanding debt or other corporate obligations. See &#8220;Use of 
Proceeds.&#8221; You may not agree with the ways we decide to use these 
proceeds, and our use of the proceeds may not yield any 
profits.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA912><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA913><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>If you own one of our existing 
6.50% Notes that are repurchased at a loss to you, your ability to claim that 
loss for tax purposes may be deferred.</I></B>&nbsp; We intend to use the net 
proceeds from this offering to repurchase and retire a portion of our existing 
6.50% Notes.&nbsp; If you own any such note and we repurchase and retire the 
note, you may realize a gain or loss.&nbsp; However, if you purchase a note 
offered in this offering, the IRS may take the position that our repurchase of 
your existing note and your purchase of the notes offered in this offering 
should be treated as a tax-deferred exchange of notes.&nbsp; If the IRS takes 
such a position, you would not be permitted to currently recognize any loss from
the repurchase of your existing note and your ability to recognize such loss 
would be deferred until you dispose of the notes being offered in this offering 
in a taxable disposition.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA914><FONT 
id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA915><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Our corporate organizational 
documents and the provisions of Texas law to which we are subject may delay or 
prevent a change in control of us that some shareholders may favor. </I></B>Our 
certificate of formation and bylaws contain provisions that, either alone or in 
combination with the provisions of Texas law described below, may have the 
effect of delaying or making it more difficult for another person to acquire us 
by means of a hostile tender offer, open market purchases, a proxy contest or 
otherwise. These provisions include:</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA916><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB918  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA919><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#9679;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA920><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A board of 
directors classified into three classes of directors with each class having 
staggered, three-year terms. As a result of this provision, at least two annual
meetings of shareholders may be required for the shareholders to change a 
majority of our board of directors.</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB922  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA923><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#9679;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA924><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The 
board&#8217;s authority to issue shares of preferred stock without shareholder 
approval, which preferred stock could have voting, liquidation, dividend or 
other rights superior to those of our common stock. To the extent any such 
provisions are included in any preferred stock, they could have the effect of 
delaying, deferring or preventing a change in 
control.</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,

FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our 
shareholders cannot act by less than unanimous written consent and must comply 
with the provisions of our bylaws requiring advance notification of shareholder 
nominations and proposals. These provisions could have the effect of delaying or
impeding a proxy contest for control of us. </FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB930  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt"><FONT id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA931><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&#9679;</FONT></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA932><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Provisions 
of Texas law, which we did not opt out of in our certificate of formation, that 
restrict business combinations with &#8220;affiliated shareholders&#8221; and 
provide that directors serving on staggered boards of directors, such as ours, 
may be removed only for cause.</FONT></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
5.05pt 0pt 54pt" id=PARA933><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK4137 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR4137 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM4137 >S-
28</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR4137 
>&nbsp;</DIV></DIV></FONT></FONT>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA934><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></FONT></FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 
0pt"><FONT size=+0><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any or all of these provisions could discourage 
tender offers or other business combination transactions that might otherwise 
result in our shareholders receiving a premium over the then current market 
price of our common stock.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA935><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA936><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>An adverse rating of the notes 
may cause their trading price to fall. </I></B>We do not intend to rate the 
notes, but if a rating agency rates the notes, it may assign a rating that is 
lower than the ratings assigned to our other debt. Ratings agencies also may 
lower ratings on the notes in the future. If rating agencies assign a lower-
than-expected rating or reduce, or indicate that they may reduce, their ratings 
in the future, the trading price of the notes could significantly 
decline.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA937><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 
0pt" id=PARA938><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Shares eligible for future sale
by our current shareholders may impair our ability to raise capital through the 
sale of our stock.</I></B> As of June 30, 2013, we had 117.8 million shares of 
common stock issued and outstanding. In addition, we currently have outstanding 
35.2 million shares of potentially dilutive securities, which mainly consist of 
approximately 28.9 million shares that are potentially convertible under our 
Convertible Notes due 2015 and 6.3 million options granted under our 2005 and 
2007 Long-Term Incentive Compensation Plan, as amended. &nbsp;We also have an 
additional 1.3 million shares of common stock allocated under our 2007 Long-Term
Incentive Compensation Plan and our 2007 Directors&#8217; Compensation Incentive
Plan. The possibility that substantial amounts of shares of our common stock may
be sold in the public market may cause prevailing market prices for our common 
stock to decrease and thus could impair our ability to raise capital through the
sale of our equity securities.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA939><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA940><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Our officers, directors, 
entities affiliated with them and certain institutional investors may exercise 
significant control over us.</I></B> In the aggregate, our management and 
directors own or control approximately 6.2% of our common stock, and several 
institutional investors own approximately another 41.0% of our common stock, 
issued as of June 30, 2013.&nbsp; These shareholders own in total approximately 
47.2%, and, if acting together, would be able to significantly influence all 
matters requiring approval by our shareholders, including the election of 
directors and the approval of mergers or other business combination
transactions.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA943.1><FONT 
id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA4138.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK4138 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR4138 >&nbsp;</DIV>

29</DIV>

noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR4138 
>&nbsp;</DIV></DIV></FONT>

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 
0pt" id=PARA946><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We caution that this document 
contains forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities
Litigation Reform Act of 1995, Section&nbsp;27A of the Securities Act, and 
Section&nbsp;21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the 
&#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;). All statements, other than statements of historical
facts, included in or incorporated by reference into this prospectus supplement 
which address activities, events or developments which the Company expects, 
believes or anticipates will or may occur in the future are forward-looking 
statements. The words &#8220;may,&#8221; &#8220;will,&#8221; 
&#8220;should,&#8221; &#8220;could,&#8221; would,&#8221; &#8220;expects,&#8221; 
&#8220;plans,&#8221; &#8220;anticipates,&#8221; &#8220;intends,&#8221; 
&#8220;believes,&#8221; &#8220;estimates,&#8221; &#8220;projects,&#8221; 
&#8220;predicts,&#8221; &#8220;potential&#8221; and similar expressions are also
intended to identify forward-looking statements. These statements are based on 
certain assumptions and analyses made by our management in light of its 
experience and its perception of historical trends, current conditions and 
expected future developments, as well as other factors we believe are 
appropriate under the circumstances. However, forward-looking statements are not
guarantees of performance and no assurance can be given that these expectations 
will be achieved. </FONT></FONT></P>

0pt" id=PARA1016><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, 
Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>

0pt" id=PARA1017><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial,

those expressed or implied by the statements. The cautionary statements

supplement should be considered in connection with any subsequent written or 
oral forward-looking statements that may be issued by us or persons acting on 
our behalf. We undertake no obligation to release publicly any revisions to any 
forward-looking statements to reflect events or circumstances after the date 
hereof or to reflect the occurrence of unanticipated events.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA1018><FONT 
id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA1019><FONT 
id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B>USE OF PROCEEDS</B></FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA1020><FONT 
id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA1021><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We estimate that our net proceeds 
from the sale of the notes will be approximately $107.8 million (or 
approximately $124.1 million if the underwriter exercises its option to purchase
additional notes) after deducting the underwriting fees and all estimated 
offering expenses that are payable by us. We intend to use the net proceeds from
the sale of the securities to repurchase in individual transactions from time to
time certain of our outstanding 6.50% Notes. We intend to use any remaining net 
proceeds for general corporate purposes, including to fund our exploration and 
production efforts or other projects, or to reduce or refinance our outstanding 
debt or other corporate obligations.</FONT></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 35pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA1022><FONT id=clearSpaces><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></FONT></P>

id=clearSpaces>&nbsp;</FONT></P>

serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" 
id=TBL1093.finRow.14.symb.3><B>$</B></TD>

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA4142><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>PRICE RANGE OF OUR COMMON STOCK</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA4143><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA4144><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On June 30, 2013, we had 117,813,072 shares of common 
stock outstanding, beneficially held by an estimated 13,154 holders. Our common 
stock is listed on the NYSE under the symbol &#8220;BPZ.&#8221;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 10.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA4145><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

id=PARA4146><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The closing price of our common stock on September 18, 
2013 as reported on the NYSE, was $2.41 per share. The following table shows the
high and low intraday sales prices of our common stock during 2011, 2012, and 
2013 through June 30, 2013:</FONT></P>
