serif; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" 
id=TBL5192.finRow.5.amt.2>43,829</TD>
<TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; PADDING-BOTTOM: 3px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; 
WIDTH: 1%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; MARGIN-LEFT:
0pt; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: bottom" id=TBL5192.finRow.5.trail.2 
noWrap>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5193><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5194>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5195><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We currently intend to use cash on hand to pay off the 
outstanding debt under our $40.0 million secured debt facility following this 
offering. We currently know of no reason&nbsp;why we cannot or will not pay off 
the $40.0 million secured debt facility from available funds based on our 
expected current cash position following this offering. Should we not pay off 
the $40.0 million secured debt facility, it may become necessary to seek waivers
for certain performance covenants based on quarterly targets.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5196>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5197><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>$75.0 Million Secured Debt Facility</B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5198>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5199><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On May 9, 2013, we repaid the remaining principal 
balance under our $75.0 million secured debt facility with Credit Suisse. As a 
result of the prepayment of the remaining $30.5 million of the $75.0 million
secured debt facility during the second quarter of 2013, we incurred $2.4 
million of fees and a prepayment premium and expensed $1.4 million of the 
remaining unamortized debt issue costs. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5200>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5201><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>$170.9 Million Convertible Notes due 2015</B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5202>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5203><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">During the first quarter of 2010, we closed on a private
offering for an aggregate of $170.9 million of convertible notes due 2015 (the 
&#8220;6.50% Notes&#8221;).&nbsp;&nbsp;The 6.50% Notes are our general senior 
unsecured obligations and rank equally in right of payment with all of our other
existing and future senior unsecured indebtedness. &nbsp;The 6.50% Notes are 
effectively subordinate to all of our secured indebtedness to the extent of the 
value of the assets collateralizing such indebtedness. &nbsp;The 6.50% Notes are
not guaranteed by our subsidiaries.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5204>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5205><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The interest rate on these notes&nbsp;is 6.50% per year 
with interest payments due on March&nbsp;1st and September&nbsp;1st of each 
year.&nbsp; The 6.50% Notes mature with repayment of $170.9 million (assuming no
conversion) due on March&nbsp;1, 2015.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5206>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5207><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The initial conversion rate of 148.3856 shares per 
$1,000 principal amount (equal to an initial conversion price of approximately 
$6.74 per share of common stock) was adjusted on February 3, 2011 in accordance 
with the terms of the Indenture.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5208>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5209><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As a result, the conversion rate and conversion price 
changed to 169.0082 and $5.9169, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon conversion, we 
must deliver, at our option, either (1)&nbsp;a number of shares of our common 
stock determined as set forth in the Indenture, (2)&nbsp;cash, or (3)&nbsp;a 
combination of cash and shares of our common stock.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5210>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5211><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;Holders may convert their 6.50% Notes at their 
option at any time prior to the close of business on the second business day 
immediately preceding the maturity date under any of the following 
circumstances:</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5212>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5213><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(1)&nbsp;during any fiscal quarter (and only during such
fiscal quarter) commencing after March&nbsp;31, 2010, if the last reported sale 
price of our common stock is greater than or equal to 130% of the conversion 
price of the 6.50% Notes for at least 20 trading days in the period of 30 
consecutive trading days ending on the last trading day of the preceding fiscal 
quarter;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5214>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5215><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(2)&nbsp;prior to January&nbsp;1, 2015, during the five 
(5)&nbsp;business-day period after any ten (10) consecutive trading-day period 
in which the trading price of $1,000 principal amount of the 6.50% Notes for 
each trading day in the measurement period was less than 97% of the product of 
the last reported sale price of our common stock and the conversion rate on such
trading day;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5216>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5217><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(3)&nbsp;if the 6.50% Notes have been called for 
redemption; or</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5218>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5219><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(4)&nbsp;upon the occurrence of one of a specified 
number of corporate transactions.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5220>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5876.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5876 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5876 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5876 >S-
55</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5876 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5876.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5221><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Holders may also convert the 6.50% Notes at their option
at any time beginning on February&nbsp;1, 2015, and ending at the close of 
business on the second business day immediately preceding the maturity 
date.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5222>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5223><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">On or after February&nbsp;3, 2013, we may redeem for 
cash all or a portion of the 6.50% Notes at a redemption price of 100% of the 
principal amount of the notes to be redeemed plus any accrued and unpaid 
interest to, but not including, the redemption date, plus a &#8220;make-
whole&#8221; payment if: (1)&nbsp;for at least 20 trading days in any 
consecutive 30 trading days ending within 5 trading days immediately before the 
date we mail the redemption notice, the &#8220;last reported sale price&#8221; 
of our common stock exceeded 175% of the conversion price in effect on that 
trading day, and (2)&nbsp;there is no continuing default with respect to the 
notes that has not been cured or waived on or before the redemption 
date.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5224>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5225><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If we experience any one of certain specified types of 
corporate transactions, holders may require us to purchase all or a portion of 
their 6.50% Notes. Any repurchase of the notes pursuant to these provisions will
be for cash at a price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the notes to be 
purchased plus any accrued and unpaid interest to, but excluding, the purchase 
date.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5226>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5227><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The indenture contains customary terms and covenants and
events of default, the occurrence and continuation of which could result in the 
acceleration of amounts due under the 6.50% Notes.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5228>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5229><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following table is the estimated remaining cash 
payments, including interest payments related to the 6.50% Notes, assuming no 
conversion (in thousands):</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5230>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA2719>

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5250><FONT

Notes</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: right; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; WIDTH: 1%; FONT-FAMILY:

id=TBL5255.finRow.5.amt.2>193,160</TD>
<TD style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; PADDING-BOTTOM: 3px; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #ffffff; 
WIDTH: 1%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; MARGIN-LEFT:

noWrap>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5256><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5257>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5258><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As of June 30, 2013, the net amount of $157.1 million 
includes the $170.9 million of principal reduced by $13.8 million of the 
remaining unamortized discount.&nbsp;&nbsp;The net amount of the equity 
component is $33.3 million, which includes the initial discount of $34.6 million
reduced by $1.3 million of direct transaction costs.&nbsp;&nbsp;The remaining 
unamortized discount of $13.8 million will be amortized into interest expense, 
using the effective interest method, over the remaining life of the loan 
agreement, whose term expires in March&nbsp;2015.&nbsp; At June 30, 2013, using 
the conversion rate of 169.0082 shares per $1,000 principal amount of the 6.50% 
Notes, if the $170.9 million of principal were converted into shares of common 
stock, the notes would convert into approximately 28.9 million shares of common 
stock.&nbsp; As of June 30, 2013, there is no excess if-converted value to the 
holders of the 6.50% Notes as the price of our common stock at June 30, 2013, 
$1.79 per share, is less than the conversion price.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5259>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5260 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5260 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5260 >S-
56</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5260 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5260.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5261><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>BOOK-ENTRY, DELIVERY AND FORM</B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5262>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5263><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The certificates representing the notes will be issued 
in fully registered form without interest coupons. Except as set forth below, 
notes will be issued in registered, global form in minimum denominations of 
$1,000 and integral multiples of $1,000 in excess thereof (the &#8220;Global 
Notes&#8221;). The Global Notes will be deposited upon issuance with the 
trustee, as custodian for The Depository Trust Company (&#8220;DTC&#8221;), in 
New York, New York, and registered in the name of DTC or its nominee, in each 
case for credit to an account of a direct or indirect participant in DTC as 
described below. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5264>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5265><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>The Global Notes</B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5266>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5267><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We expect that, pursuant to procedures established by 
DTC, (i) upon the issuance of the Global Notes, DTC or its custodian will 
credit, on its internal system, the principal amount at maturity of the 
individual beneficial interests represented by such Global Notes to the 
respective accounts of persons who have accounts with such depositary 
(&#8220;participants&#8221;) and (ii) ownership of beneficial interests in the 
Global Notes will be shown on, and the transfer of such ownership will be 
effected only through, records maintained by DTC or its nominee (with respect to
interests of participants) and the records of participants (with respect to 
interests of persons other than participants). Such accounts initially will be 
designated by or on behalf of the underwriter and ownership of beneficial 
interests in the Global Notes will be limited to participants or persons who 
hold interests through participants. Holders may hold their interests in the 
Global Notes directly through DTC if they are participants in such system, or 
indirectly through organizations that are participants in such 
system.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5268>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5269><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">So long as DTC or its nominee is the registered owner or
holder of the notes, DTC or such nominee, as the case may be, will be considered
the sole owner or holder of the notes represented by such Global Notes for all 
purposes under the indenture. No beneficial owner of an interest in the Global 
Notes will be able to transfer that interest except in accordance with 
DTC&#8217;s procedures, in addition to those provided for under the indenture 
with respect to the notes.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5270>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5271><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Payments of the principal of, and premium (if any) and 
interest (including additional interest, if any) on, the Global Notes will be 
made to DTC or its nominee, as the case may be, as the registered owner thereof.
None of the issuer, the trustee or any paying agent will have any responsibility
or liability for any aspect of the records relating to or payments made on 
account of beneficial ownership interests in the Global Notes or for 
maintaining, supervising or reviewing any records relating to such beneficial 
ownership interest.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5272>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5273><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We expect that DTC or its nominee, upon receipt of any 
payment of principal of, and premium (if any) and interest (including additional
interest, if any) on the Global Notes, will credit participants&#8217; accounts 
with payments in amounts proportionate to their respective beneficial interests 
in the principal amount of the Global Notes as shown on the records of DTC or 
its nominee. We also expect that payments by participants to owners of 
beneficial interests in the Global Notes held through such participants will be 
governed by standing instructions and customary practice, as is now the case 
with securities held for the accounts of customers registered in the names of 
nominees for such customers. Such payments will be the responsibility of such 
participants.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5274>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5275><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Transfers between participants in DTC will be effected 
in the ordinary way through DTC&#8217;s same-day funds system in accordance with
DTC rules and will be settled in same-day funds. If a holder requires physical 
delivery of a Certificated Security, such holder must transfer its interest in a
Global Note, in accordance with the normal procedures of DTC and with the 
procedures set forth in the Indenture.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5276>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5277><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">DTC has advised us that it will take any action 
permitted to be taken by a holder of notes (including the presentation of notes 
for exchange as described below) only at the direction of one or more 
participants to whose account the DTC interests in the Global Notes are credited
and only in respect of such portion of the aggregate principal amount of notes 
as to which such participant or participants has or have given such direction. 
However, if there is an event of default under the indenture, DTC will exchange 
the Global Notes for Certificated Securities, which it will distribute to its 
participants.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5278>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5279><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">DTC has advised us as follows: DTC is a limited-purpose 
trust company organized under New York banking law, a &#8220;banking 
organization&#8221; within the meaning of the New York banking law, a member of 
the Federal Reserve System, a &#8220;clearing corporation&#8221; within the 
meaning of the New York Uniform Commercial Code and a &#8220;clearing 
agency&#8221; registered pursuant to the provisions of Section 17A of the 
Exchange Act. DTC holds and provides asset servicing for issues of U.S. and non-
U.S. equity, corporate and municipal debt issues that participants deposit with 
DTC. DTC also facilitates the post-trade settlement among participants of sales 
and other securities transactions in deposited securities through electronic 
computerized book-entry transfers and pledges between participants&#8217; 
accounts. This eliminates the need for physical movement of securities 
certificates. Participants include both U.S. and non-U.S. securities brokers and
dealers, banks, trust companies, clearing corporations and certain other 
organizations. Access to the DTC system is also available to indirect 
participants such as both U.S. and non-U.S. securities brokers and dealers, 
banks, trust companies and clearing corporations that clear through or maintain 
a custodial relationship with a participant, either directly or 
indirectly.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5280>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5877.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5877 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5877 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5877 >S-
57</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5877 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5877.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5281><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Although DTC has agreed to the foregoing procedures in 
order to facilitate transfers of interests in the Global Notes among 
participants of DTC, it is under no obligation to perform such procedures, and 
such procedures may be discontinued at any time. None of us, the trustee or any 
paying agent will have any responsibility for the performance by DTC or its 
participants or indirect participants of their respective obligations under the 
rules and procedures governing their operations.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5282>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5283><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Certificated Securities</B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5284>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5285><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A Global Note is exchangeable for certificated notes in 
fully registered form without interest coupons (&#8220;Certificated 
Securities&#8221;) only in the following limited circumstances:</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5286>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA2719>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB5288  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 14pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA5289><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA5290><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">DTC notifies us that it is unwilling 
or unable to continue as depositary for the Global Note and we fail to appoint a
successor depositary within 90 days of such notice, 
or</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5292>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA2719>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB5293  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 14pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA5294><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA5295><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">there shall have occurred and be 
continuing an event of default with respect to the Notes under the indenture and
DTC shall have requested the issuance of Certificated 
Securities.</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5296>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5297><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The laws of some states require that certain persons 
take physical delivery in definitive form of securities that they own. 
Consequently, the ability to transfer the notes will be limited to such 
extent.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5298>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5305 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5305 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5305 >S-
58</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5305 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5305.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 23.1pt; MARGIN: 
0pt" id=PARA5306><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B>MATERIAL UNITED STATES FEDERAL INCOME TAX 
CONSIDERATIONS</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5307><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5309><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following is a summary of the material United States
federal income tax consequences of the ownership and disposition of notes and 
the shares of common stock into which the notes may be converted as of the date 
hereof. The following summary is not exhaustive of all possible tax 
considerations. This summary is based upon the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as
amended (the &#8220;Code&#8221;), regulations promulgated under the Code by the 
U.S. Treasury Department (including proposed and temporary regulations), 
rulings, current administrative interpretations and official pronouncements of 
the Internal Revenue Service (the &#8220;IRS&#8221;), and judicial decisions, 
all as currently in effect and all of which are subject to differing 
interpretations or to change, possibly with retroactive effect. Such change 
could materially and adversely affect the tax consequences described below. No 
assurance can be given that the IRS would not assert, or that a court would not 
sustain, a position contrary to any of the tax consequences described below. We 
do not intend to obtain a ruling from the IRS with respect to the tax 
consequences of the ownership and disposition of notes and the shares of common 
stock.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5310><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5311><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This summary is for general information only, and does 
not address all aspects of United States federal income taxation that may be 
important to a particular holder. Except where noted, this summary deals only 
with a note or share of common stock held as a capital asset (generally, 
property held for investment) by a holder who purchases the notes on original 
issuance at their &#8220;issue price&#8221; (generally, the first price at which
a substantial amount of the notes are sold for cash to persons other than bond 
houses, brokers, or similar organizations acting in the capacity of 
underwriters, placement agents or wholesalers) and does not represent a detailed
description of the United States federal income tax consequences applicable to 
you if you are subject to special treatment under the United States federal 
income tax laws, including if you are: a dealer in securities, a financial 
institution, a regulated investment company, a real estate investment trust, a 
tax-exempt organization, an insurance company, a person holding the notes as
part of a hedging, integrated, conversion or constructive sale transaction or a 
straddle, a trader in securities that has elected the mark-to-market method of 
accounting for your securities, a person liable for alternative minimum tax, a 
U.S. holder (as defined below) whose &#8220;functional currency&#8221; is not 
the U.S. dollar, a partnership or other entity classified as a partnership for 
United States federal income tax purposes; or a United States expatriate, a 
former U.S. citizen or a long-term resident of the United States. This summary 
does not include any description of the tax laws of any state or local 
governments, or of any foreign government, that may be applicable to a 
particular holder.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5312><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5313><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B>This summary does not address all aspects of United 
States federal income taxes and does not deal with all tax considerations that 
may be relevant to holders in light of their personal circumstances (including 
state, local or foreign tax considerations). We urge you to consult your own tax
advisor regarding your particular circumstances and the United States federal 
income tax consequences to you of the ownership and disposition of notes and the
shares of common stock into which the notes may be converted as of the date 
hereof, as well as any tax consequences arising under the laws of any state, 
local, foreign, or other tax jurisdiction and the possible effects of changes in
United States federal or other tax laws.</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5314><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5315><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">For purposes of this discussion, a &#8220;U.S. 
holder&#8221; is a beneficial owner of a note that is for United States federal 
income tax purposes:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5316><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5317><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">an individual citizen or resident of the United States;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5318><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5319><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">a corporation (or any other entity treated as a corporation for United 
States federal income tax purposes) created or organized in or under the laws of
the United States, any state thereof or the District of Columbia;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5320><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5321><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">an estate the income of which is subject to United States federal income 
taxation regardless of its source; or</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5322><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt"
id=PARA5323><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">a trust if (a) it is subject to the primary supervision of a court within 
the United States and one or more United States persons (as defined in the Code)
have the authority to control all substantial decisions of the trust or (b) it 
has a valid election in effect under applicable regulations to be treated as a 
United States person.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5324><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5325><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The term &#8220;non-U.S. holder&#8221; means a 
beneficial owner of a note or share of common stock (other than a partnership 
for U.S. federal income tax purposes) that is not a U.S. holder.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5326><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5327><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If an entity classified as a partnership for U.S. 
federal income tax purposes holds the notes or common stock, the tax treatment 
of a partner will generally depend upon the status of the partner and the 
activities of the partnership. If you are a partnership or a partner of a 
partnership holding the notes or common stock, you should consult your own tax 
advisors.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5328><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5329><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If you are considering the purchase of notes, you should
consult your own tax advisors concerning the particular United States federal 
income tax consequences to you of the ownership of the notes, as well as the 
consequences to you arising under other tax laws, including estate or gift tax 
laws and the laws of any other taxing jurisdiction.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5330><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5878.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5878 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5878 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5878 >S-
59</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5878 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5878.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5331><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>U.S. Holders</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5332><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5333><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following discussion is a summary of the material 
United States federal income tax consequences that will apply to you if you are 
a U.S. holder of notes or shares of common stock.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5334><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5335><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Payments of interest; Original Issue 
Discount</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5336><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5337><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Interest on a note will generally be taxable to you as 
ordinary income at the time it is paid or accrued in accordance with your usual 
method of accounting for tax purposes.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5338><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5339><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A note that is issued at an issue price less than its 
&#8220;stated redemption price at maturity&#8221; will be considered to have 
been issued with original issue discount for United States federal income tax 
purposes unless the note satisfies a <I>de minimis </I>threshold or is a short-
term note. The amount of original issue discount will be equal to the excess of 
the stated redemption price at maturity over the issue price. The &#8220;stated 
redemption price at maturity&#8221; of a note is equal to the sum of all 
payments required under the note other than payments of &#8220;qualified stated 
interest.&#8221; Qualified stated interest is stated interest that is 
unconditionally payable as a series of payments at least annually during the 
entire term of the note at a single fixed rate of interest. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5340>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5341><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In general, if a note has original issue discount, you 
must include the original issue discount in income as ordinary interest as it 
accrues, in accordance with a constant yield method, without regard to the 
timing of the receipt of cash payments attributable to this income and without 
regard to your regular method of tax accounting. The amount of original issue 
discount included in income is generally the sum of the daily portions of the 
original issue discount determined for each day during the accrual 
period.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5342>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5343><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A note will not be considered to have original issue 
discount if the difference between the note&#8217;s stated redemption price at 
maturity and its issue price is less than a <I>de minimis </I>amount, defined by
applicable Treasury regulations as &#188; of 1 percent of the stated redemption 
price at maturity multiplied by the number of complete years to maturity. A note
that matures (after taking into account the last possible date that the note 
could be outstanding under its terms) one year or less from its issue date will 
be treated as a short-term note. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5344>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5345><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The notes will be issued at a discount, will not be 
short-term notes and will not satisfy the <I>de minimis</I> threshold. As a 
result, the notes will have original issue discount and, for United States 
federal income tax purposes, you will be required to include original issue 
discount in income as ordinary interest as it accrues. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5346>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5347><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Certain additional payments</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5348><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5349><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In certain circumstances, the Company may be obligated 
to pay amounts on the notes that are in excess of stated interest or principal 
on the notes. These potential payments may implicate the provisions of the 
Treasury Regulations relating to &#8220;contingent payment debt 
instruments.&#8221; The Company does not intend to treat the possibility of 
paying such additional amounts as causing the notes to be treated as contingent 
payment debt instruments. Assuming that is correct, additional income will be 
recognized if any such additional payment is made, and such income would be 
taxed as described above under &#8220;&#8212;U.S. holders&#8212; Payments of 
interest; Original Issue Discount.&#8221; It is possible that the IRS may take a
different position, in which case a holder might be required to accrue interest 
income at a higher rate than the stated interest rate on the notes and to treat 
as ordinary interest income any gain realized on the taxable disposition 
(including a conversion) of the notes. The remainder of this discussion assumes 
that the notes will not be treated as contingent payment debt instruments. 
Investors should consult their own tax advisors regarding the possible 
application of the contingent payment debt instrument rules to the 
notes.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5350><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5351><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Sale, exchange, or other taxable disposition of 
notes</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5352><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5353><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Except as provided below under &#8220;&#8212; U.S. 
holders &#8212; Conversion of notes into common stock&#8221; and &#8220;&#8212; 
US holders &#8212; Conversion of notes into common stock and cash,&#8221; you 
will generally recognize gain or loss upon the sale, exchange, or other taxable 
disposition of a note equal to the difference between the amount realized (less 
amounts received with respect to accrued interest, which are treated as 
described above) upon the sale, exchange, or other taxable disposition 
(including a conversion of notes solely into cash) and your tax basis in the 
note. Your tax basis in a note will generally be equal to the amount you paid 
for the note increased by any original issue discount included in income and 
decreased by the amount of any payments (other than qualified stated interest) 
received. Any gain or loss recognized on a taxable disposition of the note will 
be capital gain or loss. If you have held the note for more than one year, such 
capital gain will be long-term capital gain. Long-term capital gains recognized 
by individuals currently are subject to preferential rates of taxation. Your 
ability to deduct capital losses is subject to limitations.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5354><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5879.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5879 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5879 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5879 >S-
60</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5879 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5879.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5355><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Conversion of notes into common 
stock</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5356><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5357><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Your conversion of a note solely into common stock (and 
cash in lieu of a fractional share of common stock) will not be a taxable event,
except that (a) the receipt of cash in lieu of a fractional share of common 
stock will result in capital gain or loss (measured by the difference between 
the cash received in lieu of the fractional share and your tax basis in the 
fractional share) and (b) the fair market value of common stock received with 
respect to accrued interest will be treated as a payment of interest (and 
accordingly treated as described above).</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5358><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5359><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Your tax basis in the common stock received upon a 
conversion of a note (other than common stock received with respect to accrued 
interest, but including any basis allocable to a fractional share) will equal 
the tax basis of the note that was converted. Your tax basis in the common stock
received with respect to accrued interest will equal the fair market value of 
the stock received. Your tax basis in a fractional share will be determined by 
allocating your tax basis in the common stock between the common stock received 
upon conversion and the fractional share, in accordance with their respective 
fair market values.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5360><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5361><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Your holding period for the common stock received will 
include your holding period for the note converted, except that the holding 
period of any common stock received with respect to accrued interest will 
commence on the day after the date of receipt.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5362><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5363><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Conversion of notes into common stock and 
cash</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5364><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5365><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The tax consequences of the conversion of a note into a 
combination of common stock and cash are not clear. If a combination of cash and
stock is received in exchange for your notes upon conversion, we intend to take 
the position that gain, but not loss, will be recognized equal to the excess of 
the sum of the fair market value of our common stock and the amount of cash 
received (other than amounts attributable to accrued interest, which are treated
as described above) over your tax basis in the note, but in no event will the 
gain recognized exceed the amount of cash received (excluding cash attributable 
to accrued interest or received in lieu of a fractional share). The amount of 
capital gain or loss recognized on the receipt of cash in lieu of a fractional 
share will be equal to the difference between the amount of cash you receive in 
respect of the fractional share and the portion of your tax basis in the note 
that is allocable to the fractional share.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA5366><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5367><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The tax basis of the shares of common stock received 
upon a conversion (other than common stock attributable to accrued but unpaid 
interest, the tax basis of which will equal its fair market value) will equal 
the tax basis of the note that was converted (excluding the portion of the tax 
basis that is allocable to any fractional share), reduced by the amount of any 
cash received (other than cash received in lieu of a fractional share or cash 
attributable to accrued interest), and increased by the amount of gain, if any, 
recognized (other than with respect to a fractional share). Your holding period 
for shares of common stock will include the period during which you held the 
notes, except that the holding period of any common stock received with respect 
to accrued interest will commence on the day after the date of 
receipt.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5368><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5369><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If you have held the note for more than one year at the 
time of conversion, any capital gain you recognize upon conversion will be long-
term capital gain. Long-term capital gains recognized by individuals currently 
are subject to preferential rates of taxation. Your ability to deduct capital 
losses is subject to limitations.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5370><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5371><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Alternatively, it is possible that the conversion could 
be treated as a partial taxable sale of a note and a partial tax-free conversion
of a note. Under this characterization, you would not recognize gain or loss 
with respect to the common stock received (although common stock attributable to
accrued interest would be treated as such), and your holding period for such 
stock would include the period during which you held the notes, except that the 
holding period of any common stock received with respect to accrued interest 
would commence on the day after the date of receipt. In such case, your basis in
the note would be allocated pro rata between the common stock and cash received,
in accordance with their fair market values.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5372><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5373><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">You should consult your tax advisors regarding the tax 
treatment of the receipt of cash and common stock in exchange for notes upon 
conversion and the ownership of our common stock.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5374><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5880.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5880 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5880 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5880 >S-
61</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5880 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5880.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5375><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Constructive distributions</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5376><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5377><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The conversion rate of the notes will be adjusted in 
certain circumstances as described in &#8220;Description of 
Notes&#8212;Conversion rights&#8212;Conversion rate adjustments&#8221; and 
&#8220;Description of Notes&#8212; Conversion rights&#8212;Adjustments to shares
delivered upon conversion upon make-whole fundamental change.&#8221; Adjustments
(or failures to make adjustments) to the conversion rate that have the effect of
increasing your proportionate interest in our assets or earnings and profits may
in some circumstances result in a deemed distribution to you. If we were to make
a distribution of cash or property to stockholders (but generally not stock 
dividends or rights to subscribe for our common stock) and the conversion rate 
of the notes&nbsp;was increased pursuant to the anti-dilution provisions of the 
indenture, such increase would be deemed to be a distribution to you. In 
addition, any other increase in the conversion rate of the notes (including an 
adjustment to the conversion rate in connection with a change of control) may, 
depending on the circumstances, be deemed to be a distribution to you. 
Adjustments to the conversion rate made pursuant to a bona fide reasonable 
adjustment formula that has the effect of preventing the dilution of the 
interest of the holders of the notes, however, will generally not be considered 
to result in a deemed distribution to you. Certain of the possible conversion 
rate adjustments provided in the notes (including, without limitation, 
adjustments in respect of taxable dividends to holders of our common stock and 
those described in &#8220;Description of notes&#8212;Conversion rights&#8212; 
Adjustment to shares delivered upon conversion upon make-whole fundamental 
change&#8221;) may not qualify as being pursuant to a bona fide reasonable 
adjustment formula. If any such adjustment is made, you may be deemed to have 
received a distribution even though you have not received any cash or property 
as a result of such adjustment. Any deemed distributions will be taxable as a 
dividend, return of capital, or capital gain in accordance with the earnings and
profits rules under the Code. It is not clear whether a constructive dividend 
deemed paid to you would be eligible for the preferential rates of United States
federal income tax applicable to dividend income to individual holders. It is 
also unclear whether corporate holders would be entitled to claim the dividends-
received deduction with respect to any such constructive dividends. You should 
consult your tax advisor as to the tax consequences of constructive 
dividends.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5378><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5379><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Dividends</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5380><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5381><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Distributions, if any, made on our common stock, other 
than certain pro rata distributions of common shares, will be included in income
as ordinary dividend income when received to the extent of our current and 
accumulated earnings and profits. However, with respect to individuals, such 
dividends are generally taxed at the lower applicable long-term capital gains 
rate, provided certain holding period requirements are satisfied. Distributions 
in excess of our current and accumulated earnings and profits will be treated as
a tax-free return of capital to the extent of the holder's tax basis in our 
common stock and thereafter as capital gain from the sale or exchange of such 
common stock. Dividends received by a corporation may be eligible for a 
dividends-received deduction, subject to applicable limitations.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA5382><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5383><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Net Investment Income Tax</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5384>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5385><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Interest payments on the notes, dividends paid on shares
of common stock and gain from the sale of the note or shares of common stock may
be subject to the Net Investment Income Tax. A Net Investment Income Tax of 3.8%
is applied to certain net investment income of individuals, estates and certain 
trusts that have modified adjusted gross income above the statutory threshold 
amount. The types of net investment income subject to this tax include interest,
dividends and net capital gain from the sale of stock and notes. Prospective 
investors should consult their own tax advisors regarding the application of the
Net Investment Income Tax.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5386>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5387><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Sale, exchange, or other taxable disposition of 
common stock</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5388><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5389><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Upon the sale, exchange, or other taxable disposition of
our common stock, you generally will recognize capital gain or loss equal to the
difference between (i) the amount of cash and the fair market value of any 
property received upon such taxable disposition, and (ii) your adjusted tax 
basis in the common stock. Such capital gain or loss will be long-term capital 
gain or loss if your holding period in the common stock is more than one year at
the time of the taxable disposition. Long-term capital gains recognized by 
individuals currently are subject to preferential rates of taxation. Your 
ability to deduct capital losses is subject to limitations.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5390><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5391><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Information reporting and backup 
withholding</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5392><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5393><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Information reporting requirements generally will apply 
to payments of interest on the notes, dividends on shares of common stock and 
the proceeds of a sale of a note or share of common stock paid to you unless you
are an exempt recipient. Backup withholding will apply to those payments if you 
fail to provide your taxpayer identification number, or certification of exempt 
status, or if you otherwise fail to comply with applicable requirements to 
establish an exemption.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5394><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5395><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any amounts withheld under the backup withholding rules 
will be allowed as a credit against your United States federal income tax 
liability, and may entitle you to a refund, provided the required information is
timely furnished to the IRS.</FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5881.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5881 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5881 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5881 >S-
62</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5881 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5881.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5397><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Non-U.S. holders</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5398><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>&nbsp;</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5399><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following discussion is a summary of the material 
United States federal income tax consequences that will apply to you if you are 
a non-U.S. holder of notes or shares of common stock.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5400><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5401><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Payments of interest</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5402><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5403><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Subject to the discussion below concerning backup 
withholding, the 30% United States federal withholding tax will not apply to any
payment to you of interest (or original issue discount) on a note under the 
&#8220;portfolio interest exemption&#8221; provided that:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5404><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5405><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">interest paid on the note is not effectively connected with your conduct 
of a trade or business in the United States;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5406><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5407><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">you do not actually (or constructively) own 10% or more of the total 
combined voting power of all classes of our stock within the meaning of the Code
and applicable regulations;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5408><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5409><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">you are not a controlled foreign corporation that is related to us
actually or constructively through stock ownership; and</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5410><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5411><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">either (a) you provide your name and address on an IRS Form W-8BEN (or 
other applicable form), and certify, under penalties of perjury, that you are 
not a United States person or (b) if you hold your notes through one of certain 
foreign intermediaries, you and they satisfy the certification requirements of 
the applicable regulations.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5412><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5413><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If you do not satisfy the requirements described above, 
payments of interest made to you will be subject to 30% United States federal 
withholding, unless you provide us with a properly executed:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5414><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5415><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">IRS Form W-8BEN (or other applicable form) claiming an exemption from or 
reduction in withholding under the benefit of an applicable income tax treaty; 
or</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5416><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5417><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">IRS Form W-8ECI (or other applicable form) stating that interest paid on 
the notes is not subject to withholding tax because it is effectively connected 
with your conduct of a trade or business in the United States.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5418><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5419><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If you are engaged in a trade or business in the United 
States and interest on the notes is effectively connected with your conduct of 
that trade or business and, if required by an applicable income tax treaty, is 
attributable to a United States permanent establishment, then you will be 
subject to United States federal income tax on that interest on a net income 
basis in the same manner as if you were a United States person (although you 
will be exempt from the 30% United States federal withholding tax, provided you 
furnish a properly executed IRS Form W-8ECI). In addition, if you are a foreign 
corporation, you may be subject to an additional branch profits tax at a 30% 
rate (or lower applicable income tax treaty rate) of earnings and profits for 
the taxable year, subject to adjustments, that are effectively connected with 
your conduct of a trade or business in the United States.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5420><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5421><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Dividends and constructive
dividends</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5422><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5423><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any dividends paid to you with respect to our common 
stock (and any deemed dividends resulting from certain adjustments, or failure 
to make adjustments, to the conversion rate of the notes including, without 
limitation, adjustments in respect of taxable dividends to holders of our common
stock, see&nbsp;&#8220;&#8212;U.S. holders&#8212;Constructive 
distributions&#8221; above) will be subject to withholding tax at a 30% rate (or
lower applicable income tax treaty rate). Any withholding tax on a deemed 
dividend may be withheld from interest, shares of common stock or sales proceeds
subsequently paid or credited to you. If you are subject to withholding tax 
under such circumstances, you should consult your own tax advisor as to whether 
you can obtain a refund for all or a portion of the withholding tax. In order to
obtain reduced rate of withholding with respect to dividends (including deemed 
dividends) under an applicable income tax treaty, you will be required to 
provide a properly executed IRS Form W-8BEN certifying your entitlement of 
benefits under a treaty.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5424><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5425><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Dividends that are effectively connected with the 
conduct of a trade or business within the United States and, where a tax treaty 
applies, are attributable to a U.S. permanent establishment, are not subject to 
the withholding tax described above, but instead are subject to United States 
federal income tax on a net income basis in the same manner as if you were a 
United States person. In this case, you will be required to provide a properly 
executed IRS Form W-8ECI in order for effectively connected income to be exempt 
from withholding. In addition, if you are a foreign corporation, you may be 
subject to an additional branch profits tax at a 30% rate (or lower applicable 
income tax treaty rate) of any such effectively connected income.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5426><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5882.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5882 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5882 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5882 >S-
63</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5882 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5882.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5431><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Sale, exchange, conversion or other taxable 
disposition of notes or shares of common stock</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5432><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></FONT></P>
