<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5433><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">You will recognize gain on the sale, exchange, or other 
taxable disposition of a note as well as upon the conversion of a note into a 
combination of cash and stock or on the sale or other taxable disposition of 
shares of common stock. Nevertheless, subject to the discussion below concerning
backup withholding, such gain generally will not be subject to United States 
federal income tax unless:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5434><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5435><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">it is effectively connected with your conduct of a trade or business in 
the United States (and, if required by an applicable income tax treaty, is 
attributable to a U.S. permanent establishment);</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5436><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5437><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">you are an individual who is present in the United States for 183 days or 
more in the taxable year of that disposition, and certain other conditions are 
met; or</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5438><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5439><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">we are or have been a &#8220;U.S. real property holding corporation&#8221;
(a &#8220;USRPHC&#8221;) for United States federal income tax purposes at any 
time within (i) the five-year period preceding the disposition or (ii) your 
holding period, whichever period is shorter.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5440><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5441><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If you are described in the first bullet point above, 
you will be subject to tax on the net gain derived from the sale, exchange, 
conversion or other taxable disposition under regular graduated U.S. federal 
income tax rates (including, in the case of a foreign corporation, the possible 
imposition of a branch profits tax equal to 30% of your effectively connected 
earnings and profits, or a lower applicable income tax treaty rate). If you are 
an individual described in the second bullet point above, you will be subject to
a flat 30% (or lower treaty rate) tax on the gain derived from the sale, 
exchange, conversion or other taxable disposition, which may be offset by United
States source capital losses, even though you are not considered a resident of 
the United States.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5442><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5443><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">With respect to third bullet point above, in general, a 
corporation is a USRPHC if the fair market value of its &#8220;U.S. real 
property interests&#8221; equals or exceeds 50% of the sum of the fair market 
value of its worldwide (domestic and foreign) real property interests and its 
other assets used or held for use in a trade or business. For this purpose, real
property interests include land, improvements and associated personal property. 
The IRS regulations identify an interest in real property to include a fee 
ownership, co-ownership, or leasehold in real property.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5444><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA5445><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We have not determined whether we are a USRPHC for 
United States federal income tax purposes, and there can be no assurances we are
not, or will not become, a USRPHC. If we are or become a USRPHC, so long as our 
common stock continues to be regularly traded on an established securities 
market (within the meaning of the applicable regulations) (&#8220;regularly 
traded&#8221;), you will not recognize taxable gain on a sale of notes or common
stock, as applicable, under the third bullet point above unless:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5446><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5447><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">you recognize gain on the sale of our common stock, and actually or 
constructively own more than 5% of our common stock at any time during the five-
year period ending on the date of disposition or, if shorter, your holding 
period for the common stock;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5448><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5449><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">you recognize gain on the sale of our notes, our notes are considered to 
be regularly traded, and you actually or constructively own more than 5% of the 
notes at any time during the five-year period ending on the date of disposition 
or, if shorter, your holding period for the notes; or</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5450><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5451><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">you recognize gain on the sale of our notes, our notes are not considered 
to be regularly traded, and, as of the latest date that you acquired any of our 
notes, the fair market value of all notes held by you had a fair market value 
greater than 5% of the fair market value of our common stock.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5452><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5453><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any cash or stock that you receive on the sale, 
exchange, conversion or other taxable disposition of a note which is 
attributable to accrued interest will be subject to U.S. federal income tax in 
accordance with the rules for taxation of interest described above under 
&#8220;&#8212;Non-U.S. holders&#8212;Payments of interest.&#8221;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5454><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5455><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Non-U.S. Holders should consult their own tax advisors 
with respect to the application of the foregoing rules to their ownership and 
disposition of the notes and our common stock.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5456><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5457><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Information reporting and backup 
withholding</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA5458><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>&nbsp;</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5459><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Generally, we must report to the IRS and to you the 
amount of interest and dividends paid to you and the amount of tax, if any, 
withheld with respect to those payments. Copies of the information returns 
reporting such interest payments and any withholding may also be made available 
to the tax authorities in the country in which you reside under the provisions 
of an applicable income tax treaty.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5460><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5883.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5883 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5883 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5883 >S-
64</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5883 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5883.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5461><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In general, you will not be subject to backup 
withholding with respect to payments of interest or dividends made to you, 
provided that we (or the paying agent) do not have actual knowledge or reason to
know that you are a United States person, as defined under the Code, and we (or 
the paying agent) have received from you the statement described above in the 
fourth bullet point under &#8220;&#8212;Non-U.S. holders&#8212; Payments of 
interest.&#8221;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5462><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5463><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In addition, no information reporting or backup 
withholding will be required regarding the proceeds of the sale of a note if the
payor receives the statement described above in the fourth bullet point under 
&#8220;&#8212; Non-U.S. holders&#8212;Payments of interest&#8221; and does not 
have actual knowledge or reason to know that you are a United States person, as 
defined under the Code, or you otherwise establish an exemption.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5464><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5465><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any amounts withheld under the backup withholding rules 
will be allowed as a credit against your United States federal income tax 
liability, and may entitle you to a refund, provided the required information is
timely furnished to the IRS.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5466><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5467><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act 
</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5468>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA5469><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act 
(&#8220;FATCA&#8221;) will impose a 30% U.S. withholding tax on certain U.S. 
source payments, including interest (and OID), dividends, other fixed or 
determinable annual or periodical gain, profits, and income, and on the gross 
proceeds from a disposition of property of a type which can produce U.S. source 
interest or dividends (&#8220;Withholdable Payments&#8221;), if paid to a 
foreign financial institution (including amounts paid to a foreign financial 
institution on behalf of a holder), unless such institution enters into an 
agreement with the U.S. Treasury Department to collect and provide to the 
Treasury Department certain information regarding U.S. financial account 
holders, including certain account holders that are foreign entities with U.S. 
owners, with such institution or otherwise complies with FATCA.&nbsp; FATCA also
generally imposes a withholding tax of 30% on Withholdable Payments made to a 
non-financial foreign entity unless such entity provides the withholding agent 
with a certification that it does not have any substantial U.S. owners or a 
certification identifying the direct and indirect substantial U.S. owners of the
entity.&nbsp; Under certain circumstances, a holder may be eligible for refunds 
or credits of such taxes.&nbsp; </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5470>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5471><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">These withholding and reporting requirements will 
generally apply to U.S. source periodic payments made after June 30, 2014 and to
payments of gross proceeds from a sale or redemption made after December 31, 
2016.&nbsp; If we determine withholding is appropriate with respect to the 
notes, we will withhold tax at the applicable statutory rate, and we will not 
pay any additional amounts in respect of such withholding.&nbsp; However, the 
withholding tax will not be imposed on payments pursuant to obligations 
outstanding as of July 1, 2014; therefore, FATCA withholding should not apply to
the notes until conversion into our common stock.&nbsp; Foreign financial 
institutions and non-financial foreign entities located in jurisdictions that 
have an intergovernmental agreement with the United States governing FATCA may 
be subject to different rules.&nbsp; Prospective investors are urged to consult 
with their own tax advisors regarding the possible implications of FATCA on 
their investment in the notes.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5472>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5473><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Holders of Existing 6.50%</B> </FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, 
Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B>Notes Electing 
Repurchase</B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5474>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5475><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If you own one of our existing 6.50% Notes that are 
repurchased at a loss to you, your ability to claim that loss for tax purposes 
may be deferred<B><I>.</I></B>&nbsp; We intend to use the net proceeds from this
offering to repurchase and retire a portion of our existing 6.50% Notes.&nbsp; 
If you own any such note and we repurchase and retire the note, you may realize 
a gain or loss.&nbsp; However, if you purchase a note offered in this offering, 
the IRS may take the position that our repurchase of your existing note and your
purchase of the notes offered in this offering should be treated as a tax-
deferred exchange of notes.&nbsp; If the IRS takes such a position, you would 
not be permitted to currently recognize any loss from the repurchase of your 
existing note and your ability to recognize such loss would be deferred until 
you dispose of the notes being offered in this offering in a taxable 
disposition.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5476>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5479 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5479 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5479 >S-
65</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000"
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5479 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5479.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM:
0pt" id=PARA5480><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B>ERISA CONSIDERATIONS</B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5483>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5482><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following is a summary of certain considerations 
associated with the purchase of the notes by employee benefit plans to which 
Title I of the U.S. Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended,
which we refer to as ERISA, applies; plans, individual retirement accounts 
(IRAs) and other arrangements to which Section 4975 of the Code or provisions 
under any federal, state, local, non-U.S. or other laws or regulations that are 
similar to such provisions of ERISA or the Code, which we collectively refer to 
as Similar Laws, apply; and entities whose underlying assets are considered to 
include &#8220;plan assets&#8221; of such plans, accounts and arrangements (each
of which we call a Plan). </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5484>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5485><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Each fiduciary of a Plan should consider the fiduciary 
standards of ERISA or any applicable Similar Laws in the context of the 
Plan&#8217;s particular circumstances before authorizing an investment in the 
notes. Accordingly, among other factors, the fiduciary should consider whether 
the investment would satisfy the prudence and diversification requirements of 
ERISA or any applicable Similar Laws and would be consistent with the documents 
and instruments governing the Plan. A fiduciary of a Plan considering an 
investment in the notes should determine whether it holds any of our senior debt
securities and how any such holdings and the exercise of rights thereunder might
impact its proposed investment. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5486>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5487><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Section 406 of ERISA and Section 4975 of the Code 
prohibit Plans subject to such provisions, which we call ERISA Plans, from 
engaging in certain transactions involving &#8220;plan assets&#8221; with 
persons that are &#8220;parties in interest&#8221; under ERISA or 
&#8220;disqualified persons&#8221; under the Code with respect to the ERISA 
Plans. A violation of these &#8220;prohibited transaction&#8221; rules may 
result in an excise tax or other liabilities under ERISA and/or Section 4975 of 
the Code for those persons, unless exemptive relief is available under an 
applicable statutory or administrative exemption. Employee benefit plans that 
are governmental plans (as defined in Section 3(32) of ERISA), certain church 
plans (as defined in Section 3(33) of ERISA) and foreign plans (as described in 
Section 4(b)(4) of ERISA) are not subject to the requirements of ERISA or 
Section 4975 of the Code, but may be subject to Similar Laws. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5488>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5489><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Prohibited transactions within the meaning of Section 
406 of ERISA or Section 4975 of the Code could arise if the notes were acquired 
by an ERISA Plan with respect to which we or any of our affiliates are a party 
in interest or a disqualified person. For example, if the Company, Raymond James
&amp; Associates, Inc., or any of their respective affiliates are a party in 
interest or disqualified person with respect to an investing ERISA Plan (either 
directly or by reason of our ownership of our subsidiaries), an extension of 
credit prohibited by Section 406(a)(1)(B) of ERISA and Section 4975(c)(1)(B) of 
the Code between the investing ERISA Plan and the Company, Raymond James &amp; 
Associates, Inc., or any of their respective affiliates may be deemed to occur, 
unless exemptive relief were available under an applicable exemption (see 
below). In addition, no Plan sponsored by the Company or any of its affiliates
should purchase the notes unless the purchase, holding and conversion of the 
notes would also meet the requirements of Section 407 of ERISA relating to the 
purchase by a plan of a "qualifying employer security" from an employer would be
met.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5490>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5491><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Prohibited transaction class exemptions, or PTCEs, 
issued by the United States Department of Labor, as well as certain statutory 
exemptions available under ERISA and the Code, may provide exemptive relief for 
direct or indirect prohibited transactions resulting from the purchase, holding 
or disposition of the notes. Those class and statutory exemptions include: 
</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5492>&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL5493  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=5892><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:

<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">

<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5885><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">PTCE 96-23 &#8212; for certain transactions 
determined by in-house asset managers; </FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5494>&nbsp;</P>

<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=5891><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:

serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif,

involving bank collective investment funds; </FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5498>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA2719>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,

<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5503>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA2719>

<TR>

<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5508>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA2719>

<TR>

<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA5511><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,

<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA5512><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">ERISA &#167; 408(b)
(17); Code &#167; 4975(d)(20) &#8212; statutory exemption for certain 
transactions with service providers. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5513>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5893.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5893 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5893 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5893 >S-
66</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5893 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5893.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5514><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Because of the possibility that direct or indirect 
prohibited transactions or violations of Similar Laws could occur as a result of
the purchase, holding or disposition of the notes by a Plan, the notes may not 
be purchased by any Plan, or any person investing the assets of any Plan, unless
its purchase, holding and disposition of the notes will not constitute or result
in a non-exempt prohibited transaction under ERISA or the Code or in a violation
of any Similar Laws. Any purchaser or holder of the notes or any interest in the
notes will be deemed to have represented by its purchase and holding of the 
notes that either: </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5515>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA2719>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB5517  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA5518><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA5519><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: 
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">it is not a Plan 
and is not purchasing the notes or interest in the notes on behalf of or with 
the assets of any Plan; or </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5520>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA2719>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=MTAB5522  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA5523><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT><FONT style="FONT-
FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"></FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 
0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PARA5524><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">its purchase, 
holding and disposition of the notes or interest in the notes will not 
constitute or result in a non-exempt prohibited transaction under ERISA or the 
Code or in a violation of any Similar Laws. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5525>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5526><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In addition, any purchaser that is a Plan or that is 
acquiring the notes on behalf of a Plan, including any fiduciary purchasing on 
behalf of a Plan, will be deemed to have represented, in its corporate and its 
fiduciary capacity, by its purchase and holding of the notes that (a) neither 
the Company, Raymond James &amp; Associates, Inc., nor any of their affiliates 
(collectively the &#8220;Seller&#8221;) is a &#8220;fiduciary&#8221; (under 
Section 3(21) of ERISA, or under any final or proposed regulations thereunder, 
or with respect to a governmental, church, or foreign plan under any Similar 
Laws) with respect to the acquisition, holding or disposition of the notes, or 
as a result of any exercise by the Seller of any rights in connection with the 
notes, (b) no advice provided by the Seller has formed a primary basis for any 
investment decision by or on behalf of such purchaser in connection with the 
notes and the transactions contemplated with respect to the notes, and (c) such 
purchaser recognizes and agrees that any communication from the Seller to the 
purchaser with respect to the notes is not intended by the Seller to be 
impartial investment advice and is rendered in its capacity as a seller of such 
notes and not a fiduciary to such purchaser.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5527>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5528><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B>This summary does not address all aspects of purchase
of the notes by retirement plans and may United States federal income taxes and 
may not deal with all considerations that may be relevant to prospective holders
in light of their circumstances. For this reason and due to the complexity of 
these rules and the penalties imposed upon persons involved in non-exempt 
prohibited transactions, it is important that any person considering the 
purchase of notes on behalf of or with the assets of any Plan consult with its 
counsel regarding the consequences under ERISA, the Code and any applicable 
Similar Laws of the acquisition, ownership and disposition of notes, whether any
exemption would be applicable, and whether all conditions of such exemption have
been satisfied such that the acquisition, holding and disposition of the notes 
by the Plan are entitled to full exemptive relief thereunder. 
</B>&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5529>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5530><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Nothing herein shall be construed as, and the sale of 
notes to a Plan is in no respect, a representation by us or the underwriter that
any investment in the notes would meet any or all of the relevant legal 
requirements with respect to investment by, or is appropriate for, Plans 
generally or any particular Plan. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5531.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5531 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5531 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5531 >S-
67</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5531 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5531.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM:
0pt" id=PARA5532><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B>UNDERWRITING</B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5535>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5534><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Raymond&nbsp;James&nbsp;&amp; Associates, Inc. is acting
as the sole underwriter&nbsp;of this offering. Under the terms and subject to 
the conditions contained in an underwriting agreement dated September 19, 2013, 
the underwriter has agreed to purchase, and we have agreed to sell to the 
underwriter, $125,000,000 principal amount of the notes (other than those 
covered by the underwriter&#8217;s option). </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5537>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5536><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The underwriting agreement provides that the obligations
of the underwriter to purchase and accept delivery of the notes offered by this 
prospectus supplement are subject to approval by its counsel of legal matters 
and to certain other conditions set forth in the underwriting agreement. The 
underwriter is obligated to purchase and accept delivery of all of the notes 
offered by this prospectus supplement, if any are purchased. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5539>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5538><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We have granted to the underwriter an option, 
exercisable for 30 days from the date of this prospectus supplement, to purchase
up to $18,750,000 million additional aggregate principal amount of notes at the 
offering price less the discount. Any notes issued or sold under the option will
be issued and sold on the same terms and conditions as the other notes that are 
subject of this offering. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5541>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5540><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Stabilization </B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5543>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5542><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In connection with the offering of the notes, the 
underwriter may engage in stabilizing transactions and syndicate covering 
transactions. Stabilizing transactions involve bids to purchase the notes in the
open market for the purpose of pegging, fixing or maintaining the price of the 
notes. Syndicate covering transactions involve purchases of the notes in the 
open market after the distribution has been completed in order to cover short 
positions which may include purchases pursuant to the option. Stabilizing 
transactions and syndicate covering transactions may cause the price of the 
notes to be higher than it would otherwise be in the absence of those 
transactions. If the underwriter engages in stabilizing or syndicate covering 
transactions, they may discontinue them at any time. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5545>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5544><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Commission and Discounts </B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5547>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5546><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The underwriter proposes to offer the notes directly to 
the public at the public offering price indicated on the cover page of this 
prospectus supplement less a concession not to exceed 1.5% per note. After this 
offering, the public offering price, concession and reallowance to dealers may 
be reduced by the underwriter. No reduction will change the amount of proceeds 
to be received by us as indicated on the cover page of this prospectus 
supplement. The notes are offered by the underwriter as stated in this 
prospectus supplement, subject to receipt and acceptance by it and subject to 
its right to reject any order in whole or in part. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5549>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5548><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The following table summarizes the underwriting 
compensation to be paid to the underwriter by us, assuming both no exercise and 
full exercise of the option to purchase additional notes. We estimate that the
total expenses payable by us in connection with this offering, other than the 
underwriting discount referred to below, will be approximately $1 million. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5550><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt 0pt 0pt 36pt" 
id=PARA58><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; 
FONT-SIZE: 10pt"></P></FONT>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5737></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN:

<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA2719>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5585><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Market Making </B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5588>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5587><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The notes are a new issue of securities, and there is 
currently no established trading market for the notes. We do not intend to apply
for a listing of the notes on any stock exchange. We have been advised by the 
underwriter that it intends to make a market in the notes but it is not 
obligated to do so, and may discontinue market making at any time without 
notice. Accordingly, we cannot assure you that a liquid trading market will 
develop for the notes, that you will be able to sell your notes at a particular 
time or that prices that you receive when you sell will be favorable. If an 
active public trading market for the notes does not develop or is not 
maintained, the market price and liquidity of the notes may be adversely
affected. </FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5589><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5590><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Indemnification </B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5592>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5591><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We have agreed to indemnify the underwriter against 
various liabilities, including certain liabilities under the Securities Act, and
the Exchange Act, or to contribute to payments the underwriter may be required 
to make because of any of those liabilities.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5594>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5894.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5894 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5894 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5894 >S-
68</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5894 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5894.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5593><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Lock-up&nbsp;Agreements </B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5596>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5595><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We and our officers and directors have agreed that, for 
a period beginning on the date of the lock-up agreement and continuing through 
the close of trading on the date that is 90 days after the date of the 
underwriting agreement, we and they will not, directly or indirectly, issue, 
offer, sell, agree to issue, offer or sell, solicit offers to purchase, grant 
any call option, warrant or other right to purchase, purchase any put option or 
other right to sell, pledge, borrow or otherwise dispose of any relevant 
security. &#8220;Relevant security&#8221; means the common stock, any other of 
our or our subsidiaries&#8217; equity securities or any of and any security 
convertible into, or exercisable or exchangeable for, any common stock or other 
such equity security. Raymond James&nbsp;&amp; Associates, Inc. in its sole 
discretion may release any relevant securities subject to these lock-up 
agreements at any time without notice. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5598>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5597><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The foregoing restrictions do not apply to certain 
transactions by our directors and officers, including: </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5600>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 24.45pt" id=PARA5599><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(1) <I>bona fide</I> gifts or gifts of 
relevant securities by will or intestacy; </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5602>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 24.45pt" id=PARA5601><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(2) the transfer of relevant securities to
their affiliates, as such term is defined in Rule 405 under the Securities Act; 
</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5604>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 24.45pt" id=PARA5603><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(3) the transfer of relevant securities to
any trust for their direct or indirect benefit or their immediate family; 
provided that any such transfer shall not involve a disposition for value; 
</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5606>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 24.45pt" id=PARA5605><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(4) the transfer of relevant securities 
with the written consent of Raymond James&nbsp;&amp; Associates, Inc.; 
</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5608>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 24.45pt" id=PARA5607><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(5) transactions in relevant securities 
acquired in the open market after the completion of the offering; provided that 
no filing by any party under the Exchange Act shall be required or shall be 
voluntarily made in connection with such transaction (other than a filing on a 
Form 5, Schedule 13D or Schedule 13G (or 13D-A or 13G-A) made after the 
expiration of the lock-up period); or </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5610>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 24.45pt" id=PARA5609><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">(6) the establishment of any contract, 
instruction or plan (a &#8220;Plan&#8221;) that satisfies all of the 
requirements of Rule 10b5-1(c)(1)(i)(B) under the Exchange Act; provided, 
however, that no sales of relevant securities shall be made pursuant to a Plan 
prior to the expiration of the lock-up period (as the same may be extended 
pursuant to the provisions hereof); provided further, that we are not required 
to report the establishment of such Plan in any public report or filing with the
SEC under the Exchange Act during the lock-up period and do not otherwise 
voluntarily effect any such public filing or report regarding such Plan. 
</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5612>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5611><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In the case of any transfer pursuant to (1)&nbsp;through
(4)&nbsp;above, each resulting transferee (or trustee, as applicable) of a 
relevant security is required to execute and deliver to Raymond James&nbsp;&amp;
Associates, Inc. an agreement satisfactory to it certifying that such transferee
is bound by the terms of the lock-up agreement. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5614>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5613><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Settlement Cycle </B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5616>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5615><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We expect that the delivery of the notes will be made 
through DTC on or about September 24, 2013, which is three business days 
following the date of confirmation of sales of the notes (this settlement cycle 
being referred to as &#8220;T+3&#8221;). </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5618>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA5617><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Electronic Distribution </B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5619>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5620><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A prospectus supplement in electronic format may be made
available on websites or through other online services maintained by the 
underwriter or by its affiliates. Other than the prospectus supplement in 
electronic format, the information on the underwriter&#8217;s websites and any 
information contained in any other website maintained by the underwriter is not 
part of this prospectus supplement, the accompanying prospectus, or the 
registration statement of which this prospectus supplement forms a part, has not
been approved&nbsp;and/or&nbsp;endorsed by us or the underwriter in its capacity
as underwriter and should not be relied upon by investors.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA5621>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6454><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Selling Restrictions </B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6456>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6455><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B><I>European Economic Area </I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6458>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 33.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA6457><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In relation to each member state of the European 
Economic Area which has implemented the Prospectus Directive (each, a 
&#8220;relevant member state&#8221;), each underwriter has represented and 
agreed that, with effect from and including the date on which the Prospectus 
Directive is implemented in that relevant member state (the &#8220;relevant 
implementation date&#8221;), it has not made and will not make an offer of notes
to the public in that relevant member state prior to the publication of a 
prospectus in relation to such offer that has been approved by the competent 
authority in that relevant member state or, where appropriate, approved in 
another relevant member state and notified to the competent authority in that 
relevant member state, all in accordance with the Prospectus Directive, except 
that, it may, with effect from and including the relevant implementation date, 
make an offer of notes in that relevant member state at any time: </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6522.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK6522 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR6522 >&nbsp;</DIV>

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6471><FONT

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6475><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">in any other circumstances falling within Article 3(2) of the Prospectus 
Directive; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6478>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6477><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">provided that no such offer shall require us to publish a prospectus 
pursuant to Article 3 of the Prospectus Directive or supplement a prospectus 
pursuant to Article 16 of the Prospectus Directive. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6480>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 33.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA6479><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">For purposes of this provision, the expression an 
&#8220;offer of notes to the public&#8221; in relation to any notes in any
relevant member state means the communication in any form and by any means of 
sufficient information on the terms of the offer and the notes to be offered so 
as to enable an investor to decide to purchase or subscribe the notes, as the 
expression may be varied in that relevant member state by any measure 
implementing the Prospectus Directive in that relevant member state, the 
expression &#8220;Prospectus Directive&#8221; means Directive 2003/71/EC (and 
amendments thereto, including the 2010 PD Amending Directive, to the extent 
implemented in the relevant member state) and includes any relevant implementing
measure in the relevant member state and the expression &#8220;2010 PD Amending 
Directive&#8221; means Directive 2010/73/EU. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6482>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6481><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B><I>United Kingdom </I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6484>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 33.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA6483><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Each underwriter has represented and agreed that: 
</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6485><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt">
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL6490  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 5%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: middle">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6486><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6487><FONT

10pt">&#8226;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6488><FONT

10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6489><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">it has only communicated or caused to be communicated and will only 
communicate or cause to be communicated an invitation or inducement to engage in
investment activity (within the meaning of Section&nbsp;21 of the Financial 
Services and Markets Act 2000, as amended (the &#8220;FSMA&#8221;)), received by
it in connection with the issue or sale of the notes in circumstances in which 
Section&nbsp;21(1) of the FSMA does not apply to the issuer; and 
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6491><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt">
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,

<TR>

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6492><FONT

<TD style="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">

style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">it has complied and will comply with all applicable provisions of the FSMA
with respect to anything done by it in relation to the notes in, from or 
otherwise involving the United Kingdom. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6498>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6497><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B><I>Switzerland</I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6500>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 33.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA6499><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The notes may not be publicly offered in Switzerland and
will not be listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange (&#8220;SIX&#8221;) or on any other
stock exchange or regulated trading facility in Switzerland. This document has 
been prepared without regard to the disclosure standards for issuance 
prospectuses under art. 652a or art. 1156 of the Swiss Code of Obligations or 
the disclosure standards for listing prospectuses under art. 27 ff. of the SIX 
Listing Rules or the listing rules of any other stock exchange or regulated 
trading facility in Switzerland. Neither this document nor any other offering or
marketing material relating to the notes or the offering may be publicly 
distributed or otherwise made publicly available in Switzerland. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6502>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 33.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA6501><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Neither this document nor any other offering or 
marketing material relating to the offering, the Company or the notes have been 
or will be filed with or approved by any Swiss regulatory authority. In 
particular, this document will not be filed with, and the offer of notes will 
not be supervised by, the Swiss Financial Market Supervisory Authority FINMA 
(FINMA), and investors in the notes will not benefit from protection or 
supervision by such authority. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6504>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6503><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B><I>Dubai </I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6505>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt"><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">This prospectus supplement relates to an exempt offer in accordance with 
the Offered Securities Rules of the Dubai Financial Services Authority, or DFSA.
This prospectus supplement is intended for distribution only to persons of a 
type specified in the Offered Securities Rules of the DFSA. It must not be 
delivered to, or relied on by, any other person. The DFSA has no responsibility 
for reviewing or verifying any documents in connection with exempt offers. The 
DFSA has not approved this prospectus supplement nor taken steps to verify the 
information set forth herein and has no responsibility for the prospectus 
supplement. The securities to which this prospectus relates may be illiquid 
and/or subject to restrictions on their resale. Prospective purchasers of the 
securities offered should conduct their own due diligence on the securities. If 
you do not understand the contents of this prospectus supplement you should 
consult an authorized financial advisor. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6507>&nbsp;</P>

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6508><FONT

10pt"><B><I>Japan </I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6509>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt"><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">The notes offered in this prospectus supplement have not been and will not
be registered under the Securities and Exchange Law of Japan. The underwriter 
has agreed that it will not offer or sell any shares of common stock, directly 
or indirectly, in Japan, or to or for the benefit of any resident of Japan 
(which term as used herein means any person resident in Japan, including any 
corporation or other entity organized under the laws of Japan), or to others for
re-offering or resale, directly or indirectly, in Japan or to a resident of 
Japan, except (i)&nbsp;pursuant to an exemption from the registration 
requirements of, and otherwise in compliance with, the Securities and Exchange 
Law of Japan and (ii)&nbsp;in compliance with any other applicable requirements 
of Japanese law. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6511>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6512><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B><I>Hong Kong </I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6514>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 33.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA6513><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This prospectus supplement has not been approved by or 
registered with the Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong or the 
Registrar of Companies of Hong Kong. The notes will not be offered or sold in 
Hong Kong other than (a)&nbsp;to &#8220;professional investors&#8221; as defined
in the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) of Hong Kong and any rules 
made under that Ordinance; or (b)&nbsp;in other circumstances which do not 
result in the document being a &#8220;prospectus&#8221; as defined in the 
Companies Ordinance (Cap. 32) of Hong Kong or which do not constitute an offer 
to the public within the meaning of that Ordinance. No advertisement, invitation
or document </FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, 
Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">relating to the notes 
which is directed at, or the contents of which are likely to be accessed or read
by, the public of Hong Kong (except if permitted to do so under the securities 
laws of Hong Kong) has been issued or will be issued in Hong Kong or elsewhere 
other than with respect to notes which are or are intended to be disposed of 
only to persons outside Hong Kong or only to &#8220;professional 
investors&#8221; as defined in the Securities and Futures Ordinance and any 
rules made under that Ordinance. </FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6516>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6515><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B><I>Singapore </I></B></FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" id=PARA6518>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 33.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA6517><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This prospectus supplement has not been registered as a 
prospectus with the Monetary Authority of Singapore. Accordingly, this 
prospectus suppmenet and any other document or material in connection with the 
offer or sale, or invitation for subscription or purchase, of the notes may not 
be circulated or distributed, nor may the notes be offered or sold, or be made 
the subject of an invitation for subscription or purchase, whether directly or 
indirectly, to persons in Singapore other than (i)&nbsp;to an institutional 
investor under Section&nbsp;274 of the Securities and Futures Act (Chapter 289)
(the &#8220;SFA&#8221;), (ii)&nbsp;to a relevant person, or any person pursuant 
to Section&nbsp;275(1A), and in accordance with the conditions, specified in 
Section&nbsp;275 of the SFA or (iii)&nbsp;otherwise pursuant to, and in 
accordance with the conditions of, any other applicable provision of the SFA. 
Where the notes are subscribed or purchased under Section&nbsp;275 by a relevant
person which is: (a)&nbsp;a corporation (which is not an accredited investor) 
the sole business of which is to hold investments and the entire share capital 
of which is owned by one or more individuals, each of whom is an accredited 
investor; or (b)&nbsp;a trust (where the trustee is not an accredited investor) 
whose sole purpose is to hold investments and each beneficiary is an accredited 
investor, then securities, debentures and units of securities and debentures of 
that corporation or the beneficiaries&#8217; rights and interest in that trust 
shall not be transferable for 6 months after that corporation or that trust has 
acquired the notes under Section&nbsp;275 except: (i)&nbsp;to an institutional 
investor under Section&nbsp;274 of the SFA or to a relevant person, or any 
person pursuant to Section&nbsp;275(1A), and in accordance with the conditions, 
specified in Section&nbsp;275 of the SFA; (ii)&nbsp;where no consideration is 
given for the transfer; or (iii)&nbsp; by operation of law. </FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA6519><FONT

issuers, including us, that file electronically with the SEC. The public can

(<I>www.bpzenergy.com</I>) on which we also make available, free of charge, all

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5681><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In addition, all documents we file with the SEC under 
Sections&nbsp;13(a), 13(c), 14 or 15(d)&nbsp;of the Exchange Act (other than 
those furnished pursuant to Item&nbsp;2.02 or Item&nbsp;7.01 of Form&nbsp;8-K, 
unless otherwise stated therein) after the date of this prospectus supplement 
and prior to the filing of a post-effective amendment that indicates that all 
securities offered hereby have been sold or that deregisters all securities 
remaining unsold, will be considered to be incorporated by reference into this 
prospectus supplement and to be a part of this prospectus supplement from the 
dates of the filing of such documents. Pursuant to General Instruction&nbsp;B of
Form&nbsp;8-K, any information submitted under Item&nbsp;2.02, Results of 
Operations and Financial Condition, or Item&nbsp;7.01, Regulation&nbsp;FD 
Disclosure, of Form&nbsp;8-K is not deemed to be &#8220;filed&#8221; for the 
purpose of Section&nbsp;18 of the Exchange Act, and we are not subject to the 
liabilities of Section&nbsp;18 with respect to information submitted under 
Item&nbsp;2.02 or Item&nbsp;7.01 of Form&nbsp;8-K. We are not incorporating by 
reference any information submitted under Item&nbsp;2.02 or Item&nbsp;7.01 of 
Form&nbsp;8-K into any filing under the Securities Act or the Exchange Act or 
into this prospectus supplement, unless otherwise indicated on such Form&nbsp;8-
K.</FONT></P>

id=PARA5715><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We may offer and sell, from time to time in one or more 
offerings, shares of our debt securities, common stock, preferred stock, 
depositary shares, securities warrants or subscription rights, or any 
combination thereof. We may sell these securities to or through underwriters and
also to other purchasers or through agents. The names of any underwriters or 
agents will be stated in an accompanying prospectus supplement.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5716><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5717><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This prospectus provides you with a general description 
of the securities we may offer. Each time we sell shares of our securities, we 
will provide a supplement to this prospectus that contains specific information 
about the offering, including initial offering price to the public. The 
supplement may also add, update or change information contained in this 
prospectus. You should carefully read this prospectus, all prospectus 
supplements and all other documents incorporated by reference in this prospectus
before you invest in our securities.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA5718><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

1, 2010, the closing sale price of our common stock as reported on NYSE was
