<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5897.2>&nbsp;<FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2786><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>ABOUT THIS PROSPECTUS</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2787><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2788><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This prospectus is part of a &#8220;shelf&#8221; 
registration statement that we filed with the Securities and Exchange 
Commission, which we refer to as the &#8220;SEC&#8221;. Under this registration 
statement, we may sell any combination of the securities described in this 
prospectus from time to time in one or more offerings with an aggregate offering
price of up to $500,000,000. We may also sell our common stock from time to time
in one or more offerings with an aggregate offering price of up to $134,599,416.
This prospectus provides you with a general description of the securities we may
offer. This prospectus does not contain all the information set forth in the 
registration statement as permitted by the rules&nbsp;of the SEC. Each time we 
sell securities, we will provide a supplement to this prospectus that will 
contain specific information about the terms of that offering. That prospectus 
supplement may also add, update or change information contained in this 
prospectus. Before purchasing any securities, you should carefully read both 
this prospectus and any applicable prospectus supplement, together with the
additional information described in this prospectus under the headings 
&#8220;Where You Can Find More Information&#8221; and &#8220;Information 
Incorporated by Reference.&#8221;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2789><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2790><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">You should rely only on the information contained in 
this prospectus and in any applicable prospectus supplement, including any 
information incorporated by reference. We have not authorized any other person 
to provide you with different information. If anyone provides you with different
or inconsistent information, you should not rely on it. You should not assume 
that the information appearing in this prospectus, any prospectus supplement or 
any document incorporated by reference is accurate at any date other than as of 
the date of each such document. Our business, financial condition, results of 
operations and prospects may have changed since the date indicated on the cover 
page&nbsp;of such documents.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2791><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2792><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The distribution of this prospectus may be restricted by
law in certain jurisdictions. You should inform yourself about and observe any 
of these restrictions. This prospectus does not constitute, and may not be used 
in connection with, an offer or solicitation by anyone in any jurisdiction in 
which the offer or solicitation is not authorized, or in which the person making
the offer or solicitation is not qualified to do so, or to any person to whom it
is unlawful to make the offer or solicitation.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2793><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2794><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">When used in this prospectus or in any prospectus 
supplement, the terms &#8220;we,&#8221; &#8220;us,&#8221; &#8220;our,&#8221; 
&#8220;BPZ&#8221; and &#8220;the Company&#8221; refer to BPZ 
Resources,&nbsp;Inc., a Texas corporation, and its subsidiaries (unless the 
context indicates another meaning).</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2795><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2796><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>THE COMPANY</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2797><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2798><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><I>This is only a summary and does not contain all the 
information that may be important to you. You should carefully read the more 
detailed information contained in this prospectus, together with the additional 
information described in this prospectus under the headings &#8220;Where You Can
Find More Information&#8221; and &#8220;Information Incorporated by 
Reference.&#8221;</I></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2799><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2800><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>BPZ Resources,&nbsp;Inc.</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2801><FONT
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2802><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We are based in Houston, Texas with offices in Lima, 
Peru and Quito, Ecuador. We are focused on the exploration, development and 
production of oil and natural gas in Peru and to a lesser extent Ecuador. We 
also intend to utilize part of our planned future natural gas production as a 
supply source for the complementary development of a gas-fired power generation 
facility in Peru, which we expect to wholly- or partially-own.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2803><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2804><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We maintain a subsidiary, BPZ 
Exploraci&#243;n&nbsp;&amp; Producci&#243;n S.R.L. (&#8220;BPZ E&amp;P&#8221;), 
registered in Peru through our wholly-owned subsidiary BPZ Energy International 
Holdings, L.P., a British Virgin Islands limited partnership, and its subsidiary
BPZ Energy, LLC, a Texas limited liability company. Currently, we, through BPZ 
E&amp;P, have exclusive rights and license contracts for oil and gas exploration
and production covering a total of approximately 2.2 million acres, in four 
blocks, in northwest Peru. Our license contracts cover 100% ownership of the 
following properties: Block Z-1 (0.6 million acres), Block XIX (0.5 million 
acres), Block XXII (0.9 million acres) and Block XXIII (0.2 million acres). The 
Block Z-1 contract was signed in November&nbsp;2001, the Block XIX contract was 
signed in December&nbsp;2003 and Blocks XXII and XXIII contracts were signed in 
November&nbsp;2007. Generally, according to the Organic Hydrocarbon Law 
No.&nbsp;26221 and the regulations thereunder (the &#8220;Organic Hydrocarbon 
Law&#8221; or &#8220;Hydrocarbon Law&#8221;), the seven-year term for the 
exploration phase can be extended in each contract by an additional three years 
up to a maximum of ten years. However, specific provisions of each license 
contract can vary the exploration phase of the contract as established by the 
Hydrocarbon Law. The license contracts require us to conduct specified 
activities in the respective blocks during each exploration period in the 
exploration phase. If the exploration activities are successful, we may decide 
to enter the exploitation phase and our total contract term can extend up to 30 
years for oil exploration and production and up to 40 years for gas exploration 
and production. In the event a block contains both oil and gas, as is the case 
in our Block Z-1, the 40-year term may apply to oil exploration and production 
as well.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5898.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5898 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5898 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5898 
>1</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5898 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2806><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2807><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Additionally, through our wholly-owned subsidiary, SMC 
Ecuador Inc., a Delaware corporation, and its registered branch in Ecuador, we 
own a 10% non-operating working interest in an oil and gas producing property, 
Block 2, located in the southwest region of Ecuador (the &#8220;Santa Elena 
Property&#8221;). The license agreement covering the property extends through 
May&nbsp;2016.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2808><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2809><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B>Company Offices</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2810><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2811><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our principle executive offices are located at 580 
Westlake Park Boulevard, Suite&nbsp;525, Houston, Texas 77079 and our telephone 
number is (281) 556-6200. Our website address is <I>www.bpzenergy.com</I>. 
Information contained on our website does not constitute part of this 
prospectus.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA2814.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK2814 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR2814 >&nbsp;</DIV>

noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR2814 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA2814.2>&nbsp;<FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2817><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>RISK FACTORS</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2818><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2819><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><I>The purchase of our common stock is a substantial 
transaction involving a high degree of risk. Prior to making an investment 
decision, you should carefully consider, together with the other information 
contained in this prospectus, the following risk factors.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2820><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2821><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><I>Investors should assume that if any of the following 
risks actually materialize, our business, financial condition or results of 
future operations could be materially and adversely affected. In that case, the 
trading price of our common stock could decline, and you may lose all or part of
your investment.</I></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2822><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -10pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 10pt" id=PARA2823><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B>ITEM 1A. RISK FACTORS</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -10pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 10pt" id=PARA2824><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2825><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Risks Relating to the Oil and Natural Gas Industry, the Power Industry,
and Our Business.</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2826><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA2827><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>We have a limited operating history and have only 
engaged in start-up and development activities.</I></B> We are in the initial 
stages of developing our oil and natural gas reserves and have recently begun 
producing and selling oil from our recent discoveries under an extended well 
test program. We are also subject to all of the risks inherent in attempting to 
expand a relatively new business venture. Such risks include, but are not 
limited to, the possible inability to profitably operate our existing properties
or properties to be acquired in the future, our possible inability to fully fund
the development requirements of such properties and our possible inability to 
acquire additional properties that will have a positive effect on our 
operations. We can provide no assurance that we will achieve a level of 
profitability that will provide a return on invested capital or that will result
in an increase in the market value of our securities. Accordingly, we are 
subject to the risk that because of these factors and other general business 
risks noted throughout these &#8220;Risk Factors,&#8221; we may, in particular, 
not be able to profitably execute our plan of operation.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2828><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2829><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>In fields we have not placed into commercial 
production, we must comply with Peruvian legal and regulatory requirements to be
able to produce and sell oil after the expiration of production testing or 
approved extended well testing. If we do not obtain approval to continue our 
well testing on wells producing for more than six months, we would be required 
to suspend production from such wells and we would experience an interruption in
production that would negatively impact the revenues and cash flow associated 
with those wells.</I></B> Under new legislation regulating well testing in Peru,
all new wells may be placed on production testing for up to six months. If we 
need additional time for testing a new well, we must submit a request for the 
well to enter into an extended well test period, together with technical 
justification for such need and duration, to the DGH, the agency of the Ministry
of Energy and Mines responsible for regulating the optimum development of oil 
and gas fields. After the initial six-month period or before an approved 
extended well test period expires, we will be required to have the necessary gas
and water reinjection equipment in place to continue producing the well 
according to existing environmental regulations. We are subject to this 
legislation in our Albacora field and any new fields we develop prior to placing
them in commercial production.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2830><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2831><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">As of November&nbsp;30, 2010, we were producing oil from
the A-14XD well in the Albacora field under extended well testing and gas 
flaring permits The permit for the A-14XD well is valid through mid-
January&nbsp;2011, at which time we will need to apply for a new extended well 
testing and gas flaring permit to continue production from this well. If we do 
not receive extended well testing permits on the well in Albacora beyond the 
current six-month test period, we will experience an interruption in production 
that would negatively impact any revenue and cash flow associated with this well
until the applicable requirements are satisfied for commercial production in 
Albacora, which is anticipated to be by year end 2011. No assurance can be given
that DGH or the Ministry of Energy and Mines will grant approval of this or any 
future extended well testing and gas flaring permits requested by us. Our 
current view is that we may be able to produce our new wells for at least six 
months, under the new well testing regulations. Testing of these wells beyond 
the initial six month period will require application to the Ministry of Energy 
and Mines, which may not grant approval.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2832><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2833><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Our reserve estimates depend on many assumptions 
that may turn out to be inaccurate.</I></B> The process of estimating oil and 
natural gas reserves is complex. It requires interpretations of available 
technical data and many assumptions, including assumptions relating to economic 
factors that may turn out to be inaccurate. Any significant inaccuracies in 
these interpretations or assumptions could materially affect the estimated 
quantities and the calculation of the present value of reserves shown or 
incorporated by reference in this prospectus.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2834><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2835><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">In order to prepare our reserve estimates, our 
independent petroleum engineer must project production rates and timing of 
development expenditures as well as analyze available geological, geophysical, 
production and engineering data, and the extent, quality and reliability of this
data can vary. The process also requires economic assumptions about matters such
as oil and natural gas prices, drilling and operating expenses, capital 
expenditures, taxes, and availability of funds. Therefore, estimates of oil and 
natural gas reserves are inherently imprecise.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5899.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5899 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5899 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5899 
>3</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5899 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5899.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2836><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><BR></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2837><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Actual future production, oil and natural gas prices, 
revenues, taxes, development expenditures, operating expenses and quantities of 
recoverable oil and natural gas reserves will most likely vary from our 
estimates, and those variances may be material. Any significant variance could 
materially affect the estimated quantities and present value of our reserves. In
addition, our independent petroleum engineer may adjust estimates of proved 
reserves to reflect production history, drilling results, prevailing oil and 
natural gas prices and other factors, many of which are beyond our 
control.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2838><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2839><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">One should not assume that the net present value of our 
proved reserves prepared in accordance with the Commission&#8217;s guidelines 
referred to in this report is the current market value of our estimated oil 
reserves. We base the net present value of future net cash flows from our proved
reserves on an unweighted arithmetic average of the first-day-of-the month price
for each month during the 12-month calendar year and year-end costs. Actual 
future prices, costs, taxes and the volume of produced reserves may differ 
materially from those used in the net present value estimate.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2840><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2841><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Except as required by applicable law, we undertake no 
duty to update this information and do not intend to update this 
information.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2842><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2843><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>As of December&nbsp;31, 2009, approximately 74% of
our estimated net proved reserves were undeveloped.</I></B> <B><I>There can be 
no assurance that all of these reserves will ultimately be developed or 
produced. </I></B>We own rights to oil and gas properties that have limited or 
no development. There are no guarantees that our properties will be developed 
profitably or that the potential oil and gas resources on the property will 
produce as expected if they are developed.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2844><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2845><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Recovery of undeveloped reserves requires significant 
capital expenditures and successful drilling operations. The reserve data 
assumes that we will make significant capital expenditures to develop our 
reserves. We have prepared estimates of our natural gas and oil reserves and the
costs associated with these reserves in accordance with industry standards. 
However, the estimated costs may not be accurate, development may not occur as 
scheduled, or the actual results may not be as estimated. We may not have or be 
able to obtain the capital we need to develop these proved reserves.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2846><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2847><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>We have not been profitable since we commenced 
operations and have historically had significant working capital 
deficits</I></B>. To date we have had limited revenue and limited earnings from 
operations. Though we currently have a working capital surplus, the sources of 
our working capital surplus have generally been equity and debt financings 
rather than revenue from operations and we may incur working capital deficits in
the future. We cannot provide any assurance that we will be profitable in the 
future or that we will be able to generate cash from operations or financings to
fund working capital deficits.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2848><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2849><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>We require additional financing for the 
exploration and development of our foreign oil and gas properties and the 
construction of our proposed power generation facility, pipeline and gas 
processing facility.</I></B> Since the merger with Navidec,&nbsp;Inc. 
(&#8220;Navidec&#8221;) on September&nbsp;10, 2004 (the &#8220;Merger&#8221;), 
we have funded our operations with the net proceeds of (i)&nbsp;approximately 
$288 million in various private and public offerings of our common stock, 
(ii)&nbsp;$186.4 million in convertible debt financing, including $170.9 million
of convertible debt financing sold in a private offering and $15.5 million in 
convertible debt financing from the International Finance Corporation 
(&#8220;IFC&#8221;) that was converted into approximately 1.5 million shares of 
our common stock in May&nbsp;2008, and (iii)&nbsp;$15.0 million in a reserve-
based lending facility with IFC. We have recently begun to generate revenues 
from operations. With these funds we have begun to implement our plans to 
develop our existing oil and gas properties, but we will need significant
additional financing to fully implement our plan of operation. As we continue to
execute our business plan and expand our operations, our cash commitments 
increase and the likelihood of our seeking additional financing, either through 
the equity markets, debt financing or a combination of both, will increase over 
the next six months. If we are unable to timely obtain adequate funds to finance
our exploration and development, our ability to develop our oil and natural gas 
reserves may be limited or substantially delayed. Such limitations or delays 
could result in the potential loss of our oil and gas properties if we were 
unable to meet our obligations under the license agreements, which could, in 
turn, limit our ability to repay our debts. Inability to timely obtain funds 
also could cause us to delay, scale back or abandon our plans for construction 
of our power generation facility, pipelines and gas processing 
facility.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2850><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 40pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2851><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Future amounts required to fund our foreign activities 
may be obtained through additional equity and debt financing, joint venture 
arrangements, the sale of oil and gas interests, and/or future cash flows from 
operations. However, adequate funds may not be available when needed or may not 
be available on favorable terms. The exact nature and terms of such funding 
sources are unknown at this time, and there can be no assurance that we will 
obtain such funding or have adequate funding available to finance our future 
operations.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 40pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2852><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5900.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5900 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5900 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5900 
>4</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5900 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5900.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2853><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Any failure to meet our debt obligations or the 
occurrence of a continuing default under our debt facility would adversely 
affect our business and financial condition.</I></B> Through our subsidiaries 
BPZ E&amp;P and BPZ Marine Peru S.R.L. (&#8220;BPZ Marine&#8221;), as borrowers,
we entered into a $15.0 million senior revolving debt facility with IFC in 
August&nbsp;2008, which funded in October&nbsp;2008.&nbsp;The current facility 
is secured by a pledge of the shares of our BPZ E&amp;P and BPZ Marine Peru 
subsidiaries.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2854><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2855><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The debt facility provides for events of default 
customary for agreements of this type, including, among other things:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2856><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL2857  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=5903><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:

serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5902><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif,

documents for the first and second tranche of the senior 
debt;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

id=PARA2858><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt"

<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,

<P id=PARA5907><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

breaches;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA2862><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL2863  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=5940><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5908><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>

<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">

serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">restrictions enacted in Peru that could inhibit 
any payment a borrower is required to make under the financing documents with 
the IFC.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -31.5pt; MARGIN: 0pt
0pt 0pt 67.5pt" id=PARA2884><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2885><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Upon the occurrence of an event of default or a 
specified change of control event, each lender under our debt facility may: 
(i)&nbsp;terminate all or part of the relevant facility; (ii)&nbsp;declare all 
or part of the principal amount of the loan, together with accrued interest, 
immediately due and payable; (iii)&nbsp;declare all or part of the principal 
amount of the loan, together with accrued interest, payable on demand; or 
(iv)&nbsp;declare any and all of the security documents under the facility 
enforceable and exercise its rights under such documents, including rights of 
foreclosure against the collateral. In addition, if any borrower is liquidated 
or declared bankrupt, all loans and interest accrued on it or any other amounts 
due, will become immediately due and payable without notice.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2886><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2887><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The maximum amount available under this facility will be
reduced by $2.5 million beginning on December&nbsp;16, 2010 and every six months
thereafter during the term of the Agreement. The facility is subject to a semi-
annual borrowing base determination based on the value of oil reserves.&nbsp;In 
the event the amount outstanding exceeds the re-determined borrowing base, we 
could be forced to repay a portion of our borrowings. We may not have sufficient
funds to make any required repayment. If we do not have sufficient funds and are
otherwise unable to negotiate renewals of our borrowings, we may be required to 
arrange new financing or sell a portion of our assets.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2888><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2889><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our ability to meet our current and future debt 
obligations and other expenses will depend on our future performance, which will
be affected by financial, business, economic, regulatory and other factors, many
of which we are unable to control. If our cash flow is not sufficient to service
our debt, we may be required to refinance the debt, sell assets or sell shares
of common stock on terms that we do not find attractive, if it can be done at 
all.</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5943.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5943 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5943 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5943 
>5</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5943 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5943.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2890><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2891><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Demand for oil and natural gas is highly volatile.
A substantial or extended decline in oil or natural gas prices may adversely 
affect our business, financial condition, cash flow, liquidity or results of 
operations as well as our ability to meet our capital expenditure obligations 
and financial commitments to implement our business plan. </I></B>Any revenues, 
cash flow, profitability and future rate of growth we achieve will be greatly 
dependent upon prevailing prices for oil and gas. Our ability to maintain or 
increase our borrowing capacity and to obtain additional capital on attractive 
terms is also expected to be dependent on oil and gas prices.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2892><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2893><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Historically, oil and gas prices and markets have been 
volatile and are likely to be volatile again in the future. For example, oil and
natural gas prices increased to historical highs in 2008 and then declined 
significantly over the last two quarters of 2008. In early July&nbsp;2008, 
commodity prices reached levels in excess of $140.00 per Bbl of crude oil and 
$13.00 per Mcf for natural gas and declined to below $70 per barrel and 
approximately $4 per Mcf in August&nbsp;2009. As of November&nbsp;10, 2010, 
those prices were $87.81 per Bbl per Bbl of crude oil and $3.99 per Mcf for 
natural gas. These prices will likely continue to be volatile in the future. Oil
and natural gas are commodities and their prices are subject to wide 
fluctuations in response to relatively minor changes in supply and demand for 
oil and gas, market uncertainty, and a variety of additional factors beyond our 
control. Those factors include:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2894><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL2895  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=5946><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5944><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5945><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">international political conditions (including 
wars and civil unrest);</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA2896><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL2897  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=5967><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5947><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5948><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">the domestic and foreign supply of oil and 
gas;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA2898><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL2899  border=0 cellSpacing=0

<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=5966><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:

<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5949><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5950><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">the level of consumer 
demand;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA2900><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL2901  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=5965><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:

conditions;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=5962><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5957><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5958><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">the price and availability of alternative fuels; 
and</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA2908><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL2909  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=5961><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5959><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5960><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">overall economic 
conditions.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 54pt" id=PARA2910><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2911><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Lower oil and natural gas prices may not only decrease 
our revenues on a per unit basis, but may also reduce the amount of oil and 
natural gas we can produce economically, if any. A continuation of low or a 
further decline in oil and natural gas prices may materially affect our future 
business, financial condition, results of operations, liquidity and borrowing 
capacity, and may require a reduction in the carrying value of our oil and gas 
properties. While our revenues may increase if prevailing oil and gas prices 
increase significantly, exploration and production costs and acquisition costs 
for additional properties and reserves may also increase. We do not enter into 
hedging arrangements or use derivative financial instruments such as crude oil 
forward and swap contracts to hedge our risk associated with fluctuations in 
commodity prices.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2912><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2913><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Recent changes in the financial and credit market 
may impact economic growth, and combined with the recent volatility of oil and 
natural gas prices, may also affect our ability to obtain funding on acceptable 
terms or obtain funding under our proposed credit 
facilities.</I></B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Global financial markets and economic 
conditions have been, and continue to be, disrupted and volatile. Accordingly, 
the equity capital markets have become exceedingly distressed. These issues, 
along with significant asset write-offs in the financial services sector, the 
re-pricing of credit risk and the current weak economic conditions, have made, 
and will likely continue to make, it difficult to obtain debt or equity capital 
funding.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2914><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2915><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Due to these and possibly other factors, we cannot be 
certain funding will be available if needed, and to the extent required, on 
acceptable terms. If funding is not available as needed, or is available only on
unfavorable terms, we may be unable to meet our obligations as they come due or 
we may be unable to implement our exploratory and development plan, enhance our 
existing business, complete acquisitions or otherwise take advantage of business
opportunities or respond to competitive pressures, any of which could have a 
material adverse effect on our production, revenues and results of 
operations.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2916><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2917><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Our future operating revenue is dependent upon the
performance of our properties.</I></B> Our future operating revenue depends upon
our ability to profitably operate our existing properties by drilling and 
completing wells that produce commercial quantities of oil and gas and our 
ability to expand our operations through the successful implementation of our 
plans to explore, acquire and develop additional properties. The successful 
development of oil and gas properties requires an assessment of potential 
recoverable reserves, future oil and gas prices, operating costs, potential 
environmental and other liabilities and other factors. Such assessments are 
necessarily inexact. No assurance can be given that we can produce sufficient 
revenue to operate our existing properties or acquire additional oil and gas 
producing properties and leases. We may not discover or successfully produce any
recoverable reserves in the future, or we may not be able to make a profit from 
the reserves that we may discover. In addition, we are in a long-term testing 
program and regularly bring wells on or offline depending on technical 
performance and testing period requirements. In the event that we are unable to 
produce sufficient operating revenue to fund our future operations, we will be 
forced to seek additional, third-party funding, if such funding can be obtained.
Such options would possibly include debt financing, sale of equity interests in 
the Company, joint venture arrangements, or the sale of oil and gas interests. 
If we are unable to secure such financing on a timely basis, we could be 
required to delay or scale back our operations. If such unavailability of funds 
continued for an extended period of time, this could result in the termination 
of our operations and the loss of an investor&#8217;s entire 
investment.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2918><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5968.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK5968 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR5968 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM5968 
>6</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR5968 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA5968.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2919><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Our business involves many uncertainties and 
operating risks that may prevent us from realizing profits and can cause 
substantial losses.</I></B> Our exploration and production activities may be 
unsuccessful for many reasons, including weather, the drilling of dry holes, 
cost overruns, equipment shortages and mechanical difficulties. Moreover, the 
successful drilling of a natural gas or oil well will not ensure we will realize
a profit on our investment. A variety of factors, including geological, 
regulatory and market-related factors can cause a well to become uneconomical or
only marginally economical. Our business involves a variety of operating risks, 
including:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2920><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL2921  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>

<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">

10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>

<P id=PARA5985><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5986><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">abnormally pressured formations; 
or</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA2938><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL2939  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6010><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5987><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA5988><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">environmental hazards, such as natural gas leaks,
oil spills, pipeline ruptures and discharges of toxic 
gases.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 54pt" id=PARA2940><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2941><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Experiencing any of these operating risks could lead to 
problems with any well bores, platforms, gathering systems and processing
facilities, which could adversely affect any drilling operations we may 
commence. Affected drilling operations could further lead to substantial losses 
as a result of:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2942><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P id=PARA5990><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

life;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL2955  border=0 cellSpacing=0
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6003><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>

<P id=PARA6001><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6002><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">repairs to resume 
operations.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6020.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK6020 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR6020 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM6020 
>7</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR6020 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6020.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA2956><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2957><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If any of these risks occur, we may have to curtail or 
suspend any drilling or production operations and we could have our sales of oil
interrupted or suspended, which could have a material adverse impact on our 
financial condition, operations and ability to execute our business 
plan.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2958><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2959><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>We conduct offshore exploration, exploitation and 
production operations off the coast of northwest Peru, all of which are also 
subject to a variety of operating risks peculiar to the marine 
environment.</I></B> Such risks include collisions, allisions, groundings and 
damage or loss from adverse weather conditions or interference from commercial 
fishing activities. These conditions can cause substantial damage to facilities,
tankers and barges, as well as interrupt operations. As a result, we could incur
substantial liabilities that could reduce or eliminate the funds available for 
exploration, exploitation and acquisitions or result in loss of equipment and 
properties.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2960><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2961><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Disruption of services provided by our barges and 
tankers could temporarily impair our operations and delay delivery of our oil to
be sold.</I></B> We depend on our deck barges BPZ-01 and BPZ-02 to act as a 
tender support vessels for our offshore drilling operations in our Corvina and 
Albacora fields in Block Z-1. In addition, we have two barges under capital 
lease to use in support of our offshore oil production operations. One barge is 
used as a floating production, storage and offloading facility and the other is 
currently being used as a floating storage and offloading facility. In addition,
we have time chartered a double hull tank barge to transport crude oil from our
offshore production and storage facilities in the Corvina and Albacora fields to
the Talara refinery approximately 70 miles south of the platform where the oil 
is sold at current market prices under sales contracts with the Peruvian 
national oil company, Petroleos del Peru- PETROPERU S.A. Any disruption or delay
of the services to be provided by our barges or tanker because of adverse 
weather conditions, accidents, mechanical failures, insufficient personnel or 
other events could temporarily impair our operations, delay implementation of 
our business plan, and increase our costs.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2962><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2963><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Future oil and natural gas declines or 
unsuccessful exploration efforts may result in significant charges or a write-
down of our asset carrying values.</I></B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We follow the 
successful efforts method of accounting for our investments in oil and natural 
gas properties. Under this method, oil and gas lease acquisition costs and 
intangible drilling costs associated with exploration efforts that result in the
discovery of proved reserves and costs associated with development drilling, 
whether or not successful, are capitalized when incurred. Certain costs of 
exploratory wells are capitalized pending determinations that proved reserves 
have been discovered. If proved reserves are not discovered with an exploratory 
well, the costs of drilling the well are expensed.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2964><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2965><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The capitalized costs of our oil and natural gas 
properties, on a field basis, cannot exceed the estimated undiscounted future 
net cash flows of that field. If net capitalized costs exceed undiscounted 
future net cash flows, we must write down the costs of each such field to our 
estimate of its fair market value. Unproved properties are evaluated at the 
lower of cost or fair market value. Accordingly, a significant decline in oil or
natural gas prices or unsuccessful exploration efforts could cause a future 
write-down of capitalized costs.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2966><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2967><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We evaluate impairment of our proved oil and gas 
properties whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate an asset&#8217;s
carrying amount may not be recoverable.&nbsp;In addition, write-downs would 
occur if we were to experience sufficient downward adjustments to our estimated 
proved reserves or the present value of estimated future net revenues. Once 
incurred, a write-down of oil and natural gas properties cannot be reversed at a
later date even if oil or natural gas prices increase.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2968><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2969><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Our management team has limited experience in the 
power generation business and we need additional funding to construct power 
generation and gas processing facilities and pipelines.</I></B> Our plan of 
operation includes constructing power generation and gas processing facilities 
and pipelines in Peru and in the future potentially Ecuador. However, the 
experience of our management team has primarily been in the oil and natural gas 
exploration and production industry and we have limited experience in the power 
generation business. We have recently hired a Director of Gas-to-Power and 
Project Manager. However, we continue relying on consultants and outside 
engineering and technical firms to provide the expertise to plan and execute the
power generation aspects of our strategy and we have not yet hired all necessary
full-time employees to manage this line of business. If we do not have 
sufficient funds or if we are unable to successfully find partners to 
participate in our gas-to-power project, we will need to find alternative 
sources of funding for the construction of the power generation and gas 
processing facilities, which may not be available when needed or available on 
favorable terms.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2970><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6021.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK6021 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR6021 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM6021 
>8</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR6021 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6021.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2971><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Construction and operation of power generation and
gas processing facilities and pipelines involve significant risks and delays 
that cannot always be covered by insurance or contractual protections.</I></B> 
The construction of power generation and gas processing facilities and pipelines
involve many risks, including:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA2972><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL2973  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6050><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6022><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6023><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">supply 
interruptions;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA2974><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL2975  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6051><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6024><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6025><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">work 
stoppages;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA2976><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL2977  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6052><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6026><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6027><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">labor 
disputes;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA2978><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
