cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6063><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6048><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6049><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">possible difficulties or delays with respect to 
any necessary Peruvian regulatory 
compliance.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 54pt" id=PARA3000><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3001><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The ongoing construction and future operation of these 
facilities involve all of the risks described above, in addition to risks 
relating to the breakdown or failure of equipment or processes and performances 
below expected levels of output or efficiency. We intend to maintain 
commercially reasonable levels of insurance where such insurance is available
and cost-effective, obtain warranties from vendors and obligate contractors to 
meet certain performance levels. However, the coverage or proceeds of any such 
insurance, warranties or performance guarantees may not be adequate to cover 
lost revenues or increased expenses. Any of these risks could cause us to 
operate below expected capacity levels, which in turn could result in lost 
revenues, increased expenses and higher costs.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3002><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3003><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>The success of our gas-to-power project depends, 
in part, on the existence and growth of markets for natural gas and electricity 
in Peru and Ecuador.</I></B> Peru has a relatively well-developed and stable 
market for electricity, while the power market in Ecuador is not as well-
developed or stable. Both countries rely on hydroelectric generating capacity 
for a significant portion of their power demand. Hydroelectric plants are much 
less expensive to operate than plants that utilize natural gas, but they are 
subject to variable output based on rainfall and reservoir levels. The majority 
of the non-hydroelectric or thermal power capacity in both countries consists of
generating plants that utilize diesel or fuel oil, which are significantly more 
costly than natural gas at this time. Both countries have natural gas reserves 
and production, but neither has a well-developed natural gas infrastructure. Our
immediate business plan relies on the continued stability of the power market in
Peru (and Ecuador for the purpose of gas sales to third-party power producers in
Ecuador), and our longer-term plans depend on the further development of the 
electricity market in Ecuador. We currently do not expect to complete our power 
plant until 2012. Our assessment of the future power market and demand in Peru 
and Ecuador could be inaccurate. We are subject to the following risks 
that:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3004><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3005  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6079><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6065><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6066><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">relatively more favorable business conditions for
hydroelectric plants, a material reduction in power demand or other competitive 
issues may adversely affect the demand and prices for the electricity that we 
expect to produce by the time the power plant is 
completed;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3006><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3007  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6078><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE:
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6067><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6068><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">our lifting costs could exceed the minimum 
wholesale power prices available, making the sale of our gas 
uneconomical;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3008><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3009  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6077><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6069><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6070><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">potential disruptions or changes to regulations 
of the natural gas or power markets in these countries could occur by the time 
our power plant is completed, or we may not receive the necessary environmental 
or other permits and governmental approvals to operate our power 
plant;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3010><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3011  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6076><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6071><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6072><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">although we plan to enter into long-term 
contracts to sell a significant part of our future power production, there can 
be no assurance that we will be successful in obtaining such contracts or that 
they will be on favorable terms; and</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3012><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK6064 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR6064 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM6064 
>9</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR6064 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6064.2>&nbsp;
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3013  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6075><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6073><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6074><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">we will also be subject to the general commercial
issues related to being in the power business, including the credit-worthiness 
of, and collections from future customers and the ability to profitably operate 
our future power plants.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 54pt" id=PARA3014><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3015><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>The geographic concentration of our properties in 
northwest Peru and southwest Ecuador subjects us to an increased risk of loss of
revenue or curtailment of production from factors affecting that region 
specifically.</I></B> The geographic concentration of our properties in 
northwest Peru and southwest Ecuador and adjacent waters means that some or all 
of our properties could be affected by the same event should that region, for 
example, experience:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3016><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3017  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6103><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6080><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6081><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">severe weather (such as the effects of &#8220;El 
Ni&#241;o,&#8221; which can cause excessive rainfall and flooding in Peru and 
Ecuador);</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3018><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3019  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6102><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:

<P id=PARA6082><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6083><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">delays or decreases in production, the 
availability of equipment, facilities or 
services;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3020><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3021  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6101><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6084><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6085><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">delays or decreases in the availability of 
capacity to transport, gather or process production; 
or</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3022><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,

cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6100><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6086><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6087><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">changes in the political or regulatory 
environment.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 54pt" id=PARA3024><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3025><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Because all our properties could experience the same 
conditions at the same time, these conditions could have a relatively greater 
impact on our results of operations than they might have on other operators who 
have properties over a wider geographic area.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3026><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3027><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Along with the general instability that comes from
international operations, we face political and geographical risk specific to 
working in South America.</I></B> Presently, all of our oil and gas properties 
are located in South America, specifically Peru and Ecuador. The success and 
profitability of our international operations may be adversely affected by risks
associated with international activities, including:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3028><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3029  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6099><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6088><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6089><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">economic, labor, and social 
conditions;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3030><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3031  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6098><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6090><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6091><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">local and regional political 
instability;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3032><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3033  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6097><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6092><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6093><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">tax laws (including host-country export, excise 
and income taxes and U.S. taxes on foreign operations); 
and</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3034><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3035  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6096><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6094><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6095><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">fluctuations in the value of the U.S. dollar 
versus the local currencies in which oil and gas producing activities may be 
conducted.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 54pt" id=PARA3036><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3037><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">This instability in laws, expenses of operations and 
fluctuations in exchange rates may make our assumptions about the economic 
viability of our oil and gas properties incorrect. If these assumptions are 
incorrect, we may not be able to earn sufficient revenue to cover our costs of 
operations.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3038><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3039><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Social and political unrest in Peru could cause 
heightened scrutiny over oil and gas regulatory matters. </I></B>We believe 
there has been recent heightened scrutiny over regulatory matters concerning oil
and gas exploration and production and the award of licensing contracts in Peru,
in large part due to social and political unrest. For example, in 
August&nbsp;2008, Peru&#8217;s Congress repealed two presidential decrees that 
made it easier for companies and individuals to buy land belonging to indigenous
peoples as a result of protests from a large number of indigenous people in 
Peru&#8217;s Amazon jungle. Beginning in April&nbsp;2009, thousands of 
indigenous people again protested by blocking roads and waterways in eastern 
Peru to try to force the repeal of additional decrees facilitating oil 
exploration, commercial farming and logging in parts of the Amazon jungle, 
resulting in a violent clash between police officers and the protestors in 
June&nbsp;2009. The violence led to the suspension of several of the decrees and
the Peruvian President&#8217;s third reshuffle of his cabinet since he came to 
power in 2006.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3040><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3041><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Peru&#8217;s most recent municipal and regional
political elections were held in November&nbsp;2010, and the next Peruvian 
Presidential and Congressional election will be in April&nbsp;2011. The 
campaigning leading up to the elections will likely cause heightened political 
risk and attention to various topics, including the regulation of oil and gas 
companies operating in Peru, and related environmental law compliance. As a 
result of these or similar events, a shift in policy could occur with respect to
the regulation of oil and gas companies making it more difficult or expensive to
operate in such an environment.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3042><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3043><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Our operations in Peru and Ecuador involve 
substantial costs and are subject to certain risks because the oil and gas 
industry in Peru and Ecuador is less developed when compared to the United 
States.</I></B> Because the oil and gas industry in Peru and Ecuador is less 
developed than in the United States, our drilling and development operations, in
many instances, will take longer to complete and may cost more than similar 
operations in the United States. The availability of technical expertise and 
specific equipment and supplies may be more limited or costly in Peru and 
Ecuador than in the United States. If we are unable to obtain or unable to 
obtain without undue cost drilling rigs, equipment, supplies or personnel, our 
exploitation and exploration operations could be delayed or adversely affected, 
which could have a material adverse effect on our business, financial condition 
or results of operations. Furthermore, once oil and natural gas production is 
recovered, there are fewer ways to transport it to market for sale. Marine 
transportation is subject to risks such as adverse weather conditions, 
collisions, groundings and other risks of damage or delay. Pipeline and trucking
operations are subject to uncertainty and lack of availability. Oil and natural 
gas pipelines and truck transport travel through miles of territory and are 
subject to the risk of diversion, destruction or delay. We expect that such 
factors will continue to subject our international operations to economic and 
operating risks that companies with domestic operations do not 
experience.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3044><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6104.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK6104 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR6104 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM6104 
>10</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR6104 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6104.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3045><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>We are subject to numerous foreign laws and 
regulations of the oil and natural gas industry that can adversely affect the 
cost, manner or feasibility of doing business.</I></B> Our operations are 
subject to extensive foreign laws and regulations relating to the exploration 
for oil and natural gas and the development, production and transportation of 
oil and natural gas as well as electrical power generation. Because the oil and 
gas industry in the countries in which we operate is less developed than 
elsewhere, changes in laws and interpretations of laws are more likely than in 
countries with a more developed oil and gas industry. Future laws or 
regulations, as well as any adverse change in the interpretation of existing 
laws or our failure to comply with existing legal requirements may harm our 
results of operations and financial condition. In particular, there are 
indications that the current administration in Ecuador is likely to increase 
state intervention in the economy via new legislation and tightening control of
areas such as energy, which could have a significant impact on our ability to 
operate in that country. We may be required to make large and unanticipated 
capital expenditures to comply with governmental regulations, such 
as:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3046><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3047  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6137><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6105><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6106><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">work program guarantees and other financial 
responsibility requirements;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3048><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3049  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6136><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6107><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6108><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">taxation;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3050><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3051  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6135><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6109><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6110><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">royalty 
requirements;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt"
id=PARA3052><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3053  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6129><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6111><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6112><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">customer 
requirements;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3054><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3055  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>

<P id=PARA6114><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

<P id=PARA6116><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6118><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">unitization 
requirements.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 54pt" id=PARA3060><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3061><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Under these laws and regulations, we could be liable 
for:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3062><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3063  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6133><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6119><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6120><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">personal 
injuries;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3064><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3065  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6134><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6121><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6122><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">property and natural resource 
damages;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3066><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3067  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6128><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6123><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6124><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">governmental infringements and sanctions; 
and</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3068><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3069  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6127><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6125><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6126><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">unitization 
payments.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 54pt" id=PARA3070><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3071><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>If we fail to comply with the terms of certain 
contracts related to our foreign operations, we could lose our rights under each
of those contracts.</I></B> The terms of each of our contracts with the 
government of Peru, including our Peruvian oil and gas license contracts, 
require that we perform certain activities, such as seismic acquisition, 
processing and interpretations and the drilling of required wells in accordance 
with those contracts and agreements. We are also required to conduct 
environmental impact assessments and establish our ability to comply with 
environmental regulations. Our failure to timely perform those activities as 
required could result in the suspension of our current production and sale of 
oil, the loss of our rights under a particular contract and/or the loss of the 
amounts we have posted as a guaranty for the performance of such activities, 
which would result in a significant loss to us.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA3072><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 44pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3073><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>We are subject to the Foreign Corrupt Practices 
Act (the &#8220;FCPA&#8221;), and our failure to comply with the laws and 
regulations thereunder could result in penalties which could harm our reputation
and have a material adverse effect on our business, results of operations and 
financial condition.</I></B> We are subject to the FCPA, which generally 
prohibits companies and their intermediaries from making improper payments to 
foreign officials for the purpose of obtaining or keeping business and/or other 
benefits. Since all of our oil and gas properties are in Peru and Ecuador, there
is a risk of potential FCPA violations. We have a FCPA policy and a compliance 
program designed to ensure that the Company, its employees and agents comply 
with the FCPA. There is no assurance that such policy or program will work 
effectively all of the time or protect us against liability under the FCPA for 
actions taken by our agents, employees and intermediaries with respect to our 
business or any businesses that we acquire. Any violation of these laws could 
result in monetary penalties against us or our subsidiaries and could damage our
reputation and, therefore, our ability to do business.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 40pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3074><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6138.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK6138 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR6138 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM6138 
>11</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR6138 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6138.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3075><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>We are subject to complex environmental regulatory
and permitting laws and regulations that can adversely affect the cost, manner 
and feasibility of our planned operations.</I></B> The exploration for, and the 
development, production and sale of, oil and gas in South America, and the 
construction and operation of power generation and gas processing facilities and
pipelines in South America are subject to extensive environmental, health and 
safety laws and regulations. Our ability to conduct continued operations is 
subject to satisfying applicable regulatory and permitting controls. For 
example, we are required to obtain an environmental permit or approval from the 
government in Peru prior to conducting seismic operations, drilling a well or 
constructing a pipeline in Peruvian territory, including the waters offshore of 
Peru, where we intend to conduct future oil and gas operations. We are also 
required to comply with numerous environmental regulations in order to 
transition from exploration to commercial production in the Albacora field or 
any new fields we develop. Additionally, environmental laws and regulations 
promulgated in Peru impose substantial restrictions on, among other things, the 
use of natural resources, interference with the natural environment, and the 
location of facilities, the handling and storage of hazardous materials such as 
hydrocarbons, the use of radioactive material, the disposal of waste, and the 
emission of noise and other activities. The laws create additional monitoring 
and reporting obligations in the event of any spillage or unregulated discharge 
of hazardous materials such as hydrocarbons. Failure to comply with these laws 
and regulations also may result in the suspension or termination of our planned 
drilling operations and subject us to administrative, civil and criminal 
penalties.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3076><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3077><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our current permits and authorizations and our ability 
to get future permits and authorizations may, over time, be susceptible to 
increased scrutiny, resulting in increased costs, or delays in receiving 
appropriate authorizations. In particular, we may experience delays in obtaining
permits and authorizations in Peru necessary for our operations. We have 
currently suspended drilling in the Albacora field until our planned 3D seismic
acquisition program in Block Z-1 is carried out. In 2009, we attempted to 
acquire 3D seismic in Block Z-1, but stopped its seismic acquisition program at 
the request of the government. We are currently completing additional government
requested environmental studies to obtain the permit to begin the seismic 
acquisition program. Current indications are that permits should be granted and 
acquisition could begin in the first half of 2011. However, any material delays 
in receiving these permits could delay our ability to resume our drilling 
program in the Albacora field and could negatively affect our indicated reserves
in Albacora.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3078><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3079><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Compliance with these laws and regulations may increase 
our costs of operations, as well as further restrict our foreign operations. 
Moreover, these laws and regulations could change in ways that substantially 
increase our costs. These laws and regulations have changed in the past and have
generally imposed more stringent requirements that increase operating costs or 
require capital expenditures in order to remain in compliance. It is also 
possible that unanticipated developments could cause us to make environmental 
expenditures that are significantly higher than those we currently anticipate, 
thereby increasing our overall costs. Any failure to comply with these laws and 
regulations could cause us to suspend or terminate certain operations or subject
us to administrative, civil or criminal penalties. Any of these liabilities, 
penalties, suspensions, terminations or regulatory changes could materially 
adversely affect our financial condition and our ability to implement our plan 
of operation.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3080><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3081><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Compliance with, or breach of, laws relating to 
the discharge of materials into, and the protection of, the environment can be 
costly and could limit our operations.</I></B> As an owner or lessee and 
operator of oil and gas properties in Peru and Ecuador, we are subject to 
various national, state and local laws and regulations relating to the discharge
of materials into, and protection of, the environment. These laws and 
regulations may, among other things, (i)&nbsp;impose liability on the owner or 
lessee under an oil and gas lease for the cost of property damage, oil spills, 
discharge of hazardous materials, remediation and clean-up resulting from 
operations; (ii)&nbsp;subject the owner or lessee to liability for pollution 
damages and other environmental or natural resource damages; and 
(iii)&nbsp;require suspension or cessation of operations in affected areas or 
related sales of oil and gas.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3082><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3083><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">We have established practices for continued compliance 
with environmental laws and regulations and we believe the costs incurred by 
these policies and procedures so far have been necessary business costs in our 
industry. However, there is no assurance that changes in or additions to laws or
regulations regarding the protection of the environment will not increase such 
compliance costs, or have a material adverse effect upon our capital 
expenditures, earnings or competitive position.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3084><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3085><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Our oil and gas operations involve substantial
costs and are subject to various economic risks.</I></B> Our oil and gas 
operations are subject to the economic risks typically associated with 
exploration, development and production activities, including the necessity of 
significant expenditures to locate and acquire producing properties and to drill
exploratory wells. The cost and length of time necessary to produce any reserves
may be such that it will not be economically viable. In conducting exploration 
and development activities, the presence of unanticipated pressure or 
irregularities in formations, miscalculations or accidents may cause our 
exploration, development and production activities to be unsuccessful. In 
addition, the cost and timing of drilling, completing and operating wells is 
often uncertain. We also face the risk that the oil and/or gas reserves may be 
less than anticipated, that we will not have sufficient funds to successfully 
drill on the property, that we will not be able to market the oil and/or gas due
to a lack of a market and that fluctuations in the prices of oil and/or gas will
make development of those wells uneconomical. This could result in a total loss 
of our investments made in our operations.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3086><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6139.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK6139 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR6139 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM6139 
>12</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR6139 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6139.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3087><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Competition for oil and natural gas properties and
prospects is intense; many of our competitors have larger financial, technical 
and personnel resources that give them an advantage in evaluating and obtaining 
properties and prospects.</I></B> We operate in a highly competitive environment
for reviewing prospects, acquiring properties, marketing oil and natural gas and
securing trained personnel and equipment. In addition, changes in Peruvian 
government regulation have enabled multinational and regional companies to enter
the Peruvian energy market. We actively compete with other companies in our 
industry when acquiring new leases or oil and gas properties. Competition in our
business activities has increased and will increase further, as existing and new
participants expand their activities as a result of these regulatory changes. 
Many of our competitors possess and employ financial resources that allow them 
to obtain substantially greater technical and personnel resources than we have. 
For example, if several companies are interested in an area, Perupetro (a state 
company responsible for promoting and overseeing the investment of hydrocarbon 
exploration and exploitation activities in Peru) may choose to call for bids, 
either through international competitive biddings or through private bidding 
processes by invitation, and award the contract to the highest bidder. These 
additional resources can be particularly important in reviewing prospects and 
purchasing properties. Our competitors may be able to evaluate, bid for and 
purchase a greater number of properties and prospects than our financial or 
personnel resources permit. Our competitors may also be able to pay more for 
productive oil and natural gas properties and exploratory prospects than we are 
able or willing to pay. On the acquisition opportunities made available to us, 
we compete with other companies in our industry for properties operated by third
parties through a private bidding process, direct negotiations or some 
combination thereof. Our ability to acquire additional prospects and to find and
develop reserves in the future will depend on our ability to evaluate and select
suitable properties and to consummate transactions in a highly competitive 
environment. If we are unable to compete successfully in these areas in the 
future, our future revenues and growth may be diminished or restricted. The 
availability of properties for acquisition depends largely on the business 
practices of other oil and natural gas companies, commodity prices, general
economic conditions and other factors we cannot control or influence.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3088><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3089><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>The loss of senior management or key technical 
personnel could adversely affect us.</I></B> We have engaged certain members of 
management who have substantial expertise in the type of endeavors we presently 
conduct and the geographical areas in which we conduct them. We do not maintain 
any life insurance against the loss of any of these individuals. To the extent 
their services become unavailable, we will be required to retain other qualified
personnel. There can be no assurance we will be able to recruit and hire 
qualified persons on acceptable terms. Similarly, the oil and gas exploration 
industry requires the use of personnel with substantial technical expertise. In 
the event that the services of our current technical personnel become 
unavailable, we will need to hire qualified personnel to take their place. No 
assurance can be given that we will be able to recruit and hire such persons on 
acceptable terms. Inability to replace lost members of management or personnel 
may adversely affect us.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3090><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3091><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Insurance does not cover all risks.</I></B> 
Exploration for, and the production of, oil and natural gas can be hazardous, 
involving unforeseen occurrences such as blowouts, cratering, fires and loss of 
well control, which can result in damage to or destruction of wells or 
production facilities, formations, injury to persons, loss of life, or damage to
property, the environment or natural resources. As a result, we presently 
maintain insurance coverage in amounts consistent with our business activities 
and to the extent required by our license contracts. Such insurance coverage 
includes certain physical damage to the Company&#8217;s and third parties&#8217;
property, hull and machinery, protection and indemnity, employer&#8217;s 
liability, comprehensive third party general liability, workers compensation and
certain pollution and environmental risks. However, we are not fully insured 
against all risks in all aspects of our business, such as political risk, civil 
unrest, war, business interruption, environmental damage and reservoir loss or 
damage. Further, no such insurance coverage can insure for all operational or 
environmental risks. The occurrence of an event that is not insured or not fully
insured could result in losses to us. For example, uninsured or under insured 
environmental damages, property damages or damages related to personal injuries 
could divert capital needed to implement our plan of operation. If any such 
uninsured losses are significant, we may have to curtail or suspend our drilling
or other operations until such time as replacement capital is obtained, if ever,
and this could have a material adverse impact on our financial 
position.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA3092><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3093><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>We may not be able to replace our 
reserves.</I></B> Our future success will depend upon our ability to find, 
acquire and develop oil and gas reserves that are economically recoverable. Any 
reserves we develop will decline as they are produced unless we are able to 
conduct successful revitalization activities, or are able to replace the 
reserves by acquiring properties containing proven reserves, or both. To develop
reserves and achieve production, we must implement our development and 
production programs, identify and produce previously overlooked or by-passed 
zones and shut-in wells, acquire additional properties or undertake other 
replacement activities. We can give no assurance that our planned development, 
revitalization, and acquisition activities will result in significant reserves
replacement or that we will have success in discovering and producing reserves 
economically. We may not be able to locate geologically satisfactory property, 
particularly since we will be competing for such property with other oil and gas
companies, most of which have much greater financial resources than we do. 
Moreover, even if desirable properties are available to us, we may not have 
sufficient funds with which to acquire or develop them.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3094><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6140.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK6140 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR6140 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM6140 
>13</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR6140 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6140.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA3095><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt"><B>Risks Relating to this Offering</B></FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA3096><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3097><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Investor profits, if any, may be limited for the 
near future.</I></B> In the past, we have never paid a dividend. We do not 
anticipate paying any dividends in the near future. Accordingly, investors in 
our common stock may not derive any profits from their investment in us for the 
foreseeable future, other than through any price appreciation of our common 
stock that may occur. Further, any appreciation in the price of our common stock
may be limited or nonexistent as long as we continue to have operating losses. 
We have not been profitable and have accumulated deficits of operations totaling
$241.2 million through December 31, 2009. To date we have had limited revenue 
and no earnings from operations. There can be no assurances that sufficient 
revenue to cover total expenses can be achieved until, if at all, we fully 
implement our operational plan.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3098><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3099><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Additional infusions of capital may have a 
dilutive effect on existing shareholders.</I></B> To finance our operations we 
may sell additional shares of our common stock. During the first quarter of 
2010, we issued $170.9 million of Convertible Notes due 2015 that, if converted 
to common stock, could significantly increase the amount of our common shares 
outstanding by up to approximately 25.3 million shares currently. Our 
certificate of formation does not provide for preemptive rights. Any additional 
equity financing that we receive may involve substantial dilution to our then-
existing shareholders. Furthermore, we may issue common stock to acquire 
properties, assets, or businesses. In the event that any such shares are issued,
the proportionate ownership and voting power of other shareholders will be 
reduced. In addition, we are authorized to issue up to 25,000,000 shares of 
preferred stock, the rights and preferences of which may be designated by our 
Board of Directors. If we issue shares of preferred stock, such preferred stock 
may have rights and preferences that are superior to those of our common 
stock.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3100><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA3101><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Our operations may not generate sufficient cash to
enable us to service our debt, including the Convertible Notes due 2015. 
</I></B>Our future cash flow may be insufficient to meet our debt obligations 
and commitments. Any insufficiency could negatively impact our business. A range
of economic, competitive, business and industry factors will affect our future 
financial performance, and, as a result, our ability to generate cash flow from 
operations and to pay our debt, including the Convertible Notes due 2015. Many 
of these factors, such as oil and gas prices, economic and financial conditions 
in our industry and the global economy or competitive initiatives of our 
competitors, are beyond our control.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA3102><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3103><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">If we do not generate enough cash flow from operations 
to satisfy our debt obligations, we may have to undertake alternative financing 
plans, such as:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA3104><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3105  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6143><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6141><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6142><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">refinancing or restructuring our 
debt;</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3106  border=0 cellSpacing=0

<P id=PARA6145><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,

<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt">

10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>

<P id=PARA6146><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6147><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica,

<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6150><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:

<P id=PARA6148><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6149><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times,

Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">seeking to raise additional 
capital.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 36pt" id=PARA3109><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3110><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">However, any alternative financing plans that we 
undertake, if necessary, may not allow us to meet our debt obligations. Our 
inability to generate sufficient cash flow to satisfy our debt obligations, 
including our obligations under the notes, or to obtain alternative financing, 
could materially and adversely affect our business, financial condition, results
of operations and prospects.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA3111><FONT 
style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3112><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Shares eligible for future sale by our current 
shareholders may impair our ability to raise capital through the sale of our 
stock.</I></B> As of December&nbsp;1, 2010, we had 115,507,866 shares of common 
stock issued and outstanding. In addition, we have outstanding 5,337,465 shares 
of potentially dilutive securities, which mainly consist of options granted 
under our 2005 and 2007 Long-Term Incentive Compensation Plan, as amended. We 
also have an additional 4,462,836 shares of common stock allocated under our 
2007 Long-Term Incentive Compensation Plan and our 2007 Directors&#8217; 
Compensation Incentive Plan. During the first quarter of 2010, we issued $170.9 
million of Convertible Notes due 2015 that, if converted to common stock, could 
potentially increase the amount of our common shares outstanding by up to 
approximately 25.4 million shares currently. The possibility that substantial 
amounts of shares of our common stock may be sold in the public market may cause
prevailing market prices for our common stock to decrease and thus could impair 
our ability to raise capital through the sale of our equity 
securities.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3113><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3114><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Our officers, directors, entities affiliated with
them and certain institutional investors may exercise significant control over 
us.</I></B> In the aggregate, our management and directors own or control 
approximately 15.0% of our common stock, and several institutional investors own
approximately another 34.5% of our common stock, issued as of June&nbsp;30, 
2010. These shareholders, if acting together and owning approximately 49.5%, 
will be able to significantly influence all matters requiring approval by our 
shareholders, including the election of directors and the approval of mergers or
other business combination transactions.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3115><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6153.1>&nbsp;</P>
<DIV style="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" id=PGBK6153 >
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGFTR6153 >&nbsp;</DIV>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=PGNUM6153 
>14</DIV>
<HR style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; WIDTH: 100%; HEIGHT: 2px; COLOR: #000000" 
noShade>
<DIV style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; WIDTH: 100%" id=PGHDR6153 >&nbsp;</DIV></DIV>
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=PARA6153.2>&nbsp;</P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3116><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>Our corporate organizational documents and the 
provisions of Texas law to which we are subject may delay or prevent a change in
control of us that some shareholders may favor. </I></B>Our certificate of 
formation and bylaws contain provisions that, either alone or in combination 
with the provisions of Texas law described below, may have the effect of 
delaying or making it more difficult for another person to acquire us by means 
of a hostile tender offer, open market purchases, a proxy contest or otherwise. 
These provisions include:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3117><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3118  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6183><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6154><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6155><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">A board of directors classified into three 
classes of directors with each class having staggered, three-year terms. As a 
result of this provision, at least two annual meetings of shareholders may be 
required for the shareholders to change a majority of our board of 
directors.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3119><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3120  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6182><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6156><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6157><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">The board&#8217;s authority to issue shares of 
preferred stock without shareholder approval, which preferred stock could have 
voting, liquidation, dividend or other rights superior to those of our common 
stock. To the extent any such provisions are included in any preferred stock, 
they could have the effect of delaying, deferring or preventing a change in 
control.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3121><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3122  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6181><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6158><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6159><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Our shareholders cannot act by less than 
unanimous written consent and must comply with the provisions of our bylaws 
requiring advance notification of shareholder nominations and proposals. These 
provisions could have the effect of delaying or impeding a proxy contest for 
control of us.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-TOP: 0pt; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0pt" 
id=PARA3123><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE style="TEXT-INDENT: 0px; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, 
sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt" id=TBL3124  border=0 cellSpacing=0 
cellPadding=0>
<TR>
<TD style="WIDTH: 36pt">
<P style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px" id=6180><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY:
Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 
10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="WIDTH: 18pt; VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6160><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&#9679;</FONT></P></TD>
<TD style="VERTICAL-ALIGN: top">
<P id=PARA6161><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, 
Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Provisions of Texas law, which we did not opt out
of in our certificate of formation, that restrict business combinations with 
&#8220;affiliated shareholders&#8221; and provide that directors serving on 
staggered boards of directors, such as ours, may be removed only for 
cause.</FONT></P></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: -18pt; MARGIN: 0pt 
0pt 0pt 54pt" id=PARA3125><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-
serif, Times, serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt"
id=PARA3126><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">Any or all of these provisions could discourage tender 
offers or other business combination transactions that might otherwise result in
our shareholders receiving a premium over the then current market price of our 
common stock.</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3127><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt" 
id=PARA3128><FONT style="FONT-FAMILY: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif, Times, 
serif; FONT-SIZE: 10pt"><B><I>The market price and trading volume of our common 
stock may be volatile. </I></B>The market price of our common stock may be 
highly volatile and subject to wide fluctuations. In addition, the trading 
volume in our common stock may fluctuate and cause significant price variations 
to occur. If the market price of our common stock declines significantly, you 
may be unable to resell your shares at or above the price at which the shares 
were acquired. We cannot assure you that the market price of our common stock 
will not fluctuate or decline significantly in the future. Some of the factors 
that could adversely affect our share price or result in fluctuations in the 
price or trading volume of our common stock include:</FONT></P>
<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: left; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN: 0pt"

<P style="TEXT-ALIGN: center; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN: 0pt" id=PARA3143><FONT

These market fluctuations may materially and adversely affect the trading price 
of our common stock, regardless of our actual operating performance.</FONT></P>
